I ate only half because the tortilla tasted sweet and was just irritated! I really dont want to pay 5$ for meat and cheese! UGH! 

Go for the carne asada fries! The plus is they are open 24hrs and have a drive through!

MY FAVORITE for all hours. 
Amazing customer service and they actually treat you like a human being.

If I could give a zero review I would. Called in an order to go and still waiting for my food for over 30 minutes. Tipped the guy at the cashier five dollars in advance and still got horrible service. I won't be returning

This is my first ever yelp review, so bear with me! With that said, please take note of the fact that I decided to finally take the plunge and write a review because of this restaurant! 

It is worth mentioning that they are under new management as of about 4 months ago and from my understanding, have made many significant changes. 

Let's start with the service. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful during my visit. They were attentive and very knowledgeable on all of the menu offerings. The way the staff speaks about their food and the dishes is actually inspiring. Explanations were heavily detail orientated and the passion they have for what they do truly shines through.

The space itself is beautifully done from the moment you walk in the door; The restaurant decor, artwork to the table setup. Everything in the restaurant was in great condition and very clean. We came for lunch, unknowingly, while their lunch buffet was occurring. Multiple times during my visit I watched as the employees checked on the buffet, ensuring it was clean, trays were full and food was hot! 

And for the grand finale, the food!!! You guys, I was not just pleasantly surprised, I was blown away! As was everyone I came with. We opted for an array of a la cart menu items (some of which are offered at the buffet, as well). Again I'm going to talk about detail. The detail and care they put into the ingredients and dishes is incredible. 

We were told the mango greens salad was a top seller so we opted for that. It was so fresh, perfectly dressed, and a wonderful combination of ingredients. The Szechwan dumplings (we had the chicken) were simple, yet so flavorful and made in house! The jalapeño fish was breaded to perfection and cooked just right. 

As for entrees, the volcano shrimp was delicious!! It can be difficult to find good seafood in the valley, but rest assured, you won't have that issue here. The 5 spice lamb...wow! So tender and perfectly seasoned. The classic Mongolian beef dish did not disappoint. 

We also ordered the burnt garlic chili rice and the Hakka noodles. The rice!! Oh the rice. It was beyond delicious and certainly packed a punch. The Hakka noodles were the perfect addition to balance out some of our more spicy dishes. We were also informed that the noodles for this dish are specially made in Vietnam, specifically for this dish. How cool is that? I can honestly say that I would happily order ever single dish I tried, again and again. 

We ended our meal with the date wontons with ice cream. This is easily the most creative and interesting dessert I have ever had. The dates, to my surprise, paired so well in the fried wonton with the ice cream. The ice cream was served warm and was used for dipping. It was so good!! I am still in awe at how well this flavor combination worked together to create this dish. It is worth mentioning that the presentation and plating of each dish was so unique and beautifully done. 

The overall experience at Inchin Bamboo Garden was incomparable and I cannot wait to go back to this hidden gem.

Having had Chinese food in India while growing up, we went with a lot of anticipation. Amongst the ten of us, we ordered some twelve dishes, including hakka chicken and shrimp, chicken 65, chili garlic noodles with chicken, garlic pepper chicken and shrimp chop suey.

The Chicken 65 was very good, with slightly tangy pieces of boneless chicken that had a crunch on first bite, garnished with red and green bell peppers. The chili garlic noodles were tasty, but we initially thought there was a mistake with our order since we could not see any chicken in it.  On close inspection, we noticed a few miniscule pieces of chicken... The shrimp chop suey was about average, although the few shrimp were rather small. The garlic pepper chicken was neither garlicky nor peppery, instead swimming in a pool of watery gravy. But the biggest disappointment was the hakka dishes, which are a signature Indo-Chinese noodle dish.  These were completely bland, and we had to resort to adding more than a few dollops of the 6 sauces at the table to pretend we were having Indo-Chinese cuisine.

We wished the portions were more generous, like we get at most Chinese restaurants. We had to order a couple of extra entrees since some of us were still hungry, whereas we almost never can finish our food at other restaurants.

The service was competent bordering on perfunctory. One of us was curious about Nasi Goreng on the menu, but our server could not describe how it was prepared, instead steering us to a couple of other choices on the menu.

Our receipt invited us to share our experience at a "Talk2us" link, which only produced a "survey error."

Having had great Indo-Chinese food in Calcutta, Vancouver and Houston, we are still waiting for a comparable experience in the Phoenix area.

Best indo chinese food in phoenix. 
I would recommend this place if you like spicy food. Must go

Great Chinese food in Indian style. I and my friends were dying to eat indo Chinese food from a long time and we are glad to find this place. Chicken schezwan and American chopseuy were amazing. Would recommend to all Indians.

I had very bad experience with this place .... We went on Friday eve, it was not that crowded then also staff were behaving like they are extremely busy person and no one even showed up to take orders

We waited for 45-50 mins, after requesting several times a guy came and took Oder 

We ordered for soup and one non veg starter, it was so spicy and full of green chili, when we complained about bunch of chilies in soup, attendant was shamelessly laughing , it was like he does not care ....

I went to this place with a bunch of friends. Though overall quality of the food was not bad, Veg manchurian was little burnt. Fried rice and schezwan noodles were decent. chocolate mousse cake with ice cream was delicious.However my only complain is about terrible customer service. There was only girl that too without proper knowledge about the items on the menu.
Come for the "food" stay for the atmosphere. Fantastic patio. Location location location.  Great warm up stop.

Amazing place for a info Chinese cuisine. HV been coming here for almost an year now and never been disappointed.

They also brought their sweet chilli sauce back!!!

Place is terrible!!! All to go order was wrong.. wonton soup more like vegetable soup without Wonton....  szechuan beef terrible!!! All spices are wrong!!!! ... When I asked for chopsticks they gave me plastic ware lol

Service is absolutely horrible!!! I can't emphasize that enough. Like many Indian restaurants, the restaurant has lousy service and appears understaffed in my opinion. There was no hostess. We waited 10 minutes before anyone greeted us.  Once we were seated, no one greeted us and just kept passing by us. Yeah, I mean no one took our drink order. Finally, we had to flag a waiter and yell at them that no one even approached our table. Only then did they stop to even take an order. The water at the tables is lukewarm. The bottle they are in appeared dirty. For as nice as the restaurant appeared in terms of decor, they really should invest in a hostess and about 3 more waiters and teach them basic service etiquette.

The food is decent in my opinion. It's good but nothing noteworthy. I've had better Indian Chinese in other parts of the Valley. If the service was better, I would have considered back here. But with the lousy service, I don't recommend dining here. If you are go to dine, I recommend a few things. Bring bottles of cold water. Based on my experience, I think there is a good chance your water and drinks will not be refilled. Our water was never refilled, not once!! Also any drink they bring you will be served lukewarm. Asking for ice was like asking for gold; it's a rare commodity here in my opinion and when they brought ice in drinks, there was hardly any in the glass. Dress lightly and bring some hand held fans. The restaurant was very warm and the ventilation was poor imho. This was winter, I hate to imagine what it's like in the summer here. Arrive here with the mentality that you are in Russia circa 1980's. Expect long waits! Maybe have a few alcoholic drinks prior to arriving here to mellow you out cuz you will be frustrated.

This is a Starbucks. I generally do not like their standardized coffee and just go in for fraps (the sweetness makes the coffee bearable), but I know that there is something comforting about getting the same coffee wherever you are in the country.

What makes me want to write about this Starbucks, though, is the incredibly friendly service we received on our visit here. My cousin has a propensity for ordering from the secret menu without regard to just how much trouble it would cause the barista or how it could affect the line. On this visit, my cousin researched the recipe for the secret frappuccino menu she wanted* and the barista was incredibly patient with her. That was pretty impressive.

If you are in want of alright coffee with great customer service, this Starbucks is where you should go to.


*For those of you who are not aware, the baristas would only make the secret menu item if you know the exact recipe for it. Giving them a name of the secret menu thing is not enough.
Horrible service. Avoid at all cost. Employees are rude and condescending. Fraps were watered down and refreshers all ice.

Checking this particular Starbucks location off of my list and into the pile of locations that aren't my favorites. I have utilized mobile order twice now, allowing the estimated time frames for my items to be prepared. On both occasions, my orders haven't been ready. On my most recent visit, I ordered the spinach and egg white breakfast wrap and a coffee. The wrap was still half frozen and of course I didn't realize this until I already left the drive through. When I returned to have them re-make it, I was looked at like it was my fault... The guy even tried to take the one I gave him and heat it up more instead of doing a brand new one like he was supposed to.. Don't think I will give them another opportunity to show me that this is not the location for me...

It gets busy here and it's really hard to park because the lot is really small which it shares with another business. The inside is really small for the amount of traffic so it's hit or miss getting a seat. Lots of shady people around because it's close to the strip. The inside is really nice and clean but your kind of crammed it.

This is a Starbucks on Paradise Road that is probably the worst Starbucks that I've been to in Vegas so far. They messed up my drink two times. They put too much cream in it when I asked him for a little bit of cream. There they did not have the breakfast sandwich that I like. I think I will avoid that Starbucks in the future.

Barista from Sept 12-13th,2018 performed below standards. Drive tru order since when was it hard to prep a tall,skinny,vanilla latte??? It was too sweet as in five tablespoon of sugar!
I dropped by the next day spoke with Manager-"Jen Olvera" advised her about the experience and requested for best barista to prep it for me. However, once again it's below par---"it was 3/4 foam 1/4 drinkable. This branch's staff from top to bottom need to be retrained or replaced with passionate and proud barista appropriate for the brand. I hope Regional Manager/Director could conduct a visit

I drive by this Starbucks everyday on the way to work - it is so convenient! While the parking lot is small, the drive thru is always available and not hard to get into at all. The baristas working the drive thru are always helpful and fast-paced. I've had my drink made incorrectly once, but they had no problem fixing it for me when I brought it up. The baristas also take the time to get to know you, it really brightens up my day with how friendly they are.

I highly recommend this location, it's my favorite!

Service was good no complaints there but the restrooms were disgusting, whoever manages this establishment should have someone check on it every hour. If you can't keep a restroom clean then you shouldn't be in business.

I'm a BIG Starbucks fan and go to multiple locations weekly. This has to be the worse I've ever seen in terms of customer service.

Guy who looked like the manager is too busy talking on his headset and taking out the trash to help customers who aren't getting serviced.

Ordered the egg bites on the mobile app and asked twice if they were ready and it was like it was a real inconvenience to answer me. They said they'd be ready soon but I could see the oven was not in use and they were probably sitting at the drive through window. 

After 3 short rude replies they finally figured it out and grabbed them for us.

The guy seems like he's running around like a chicken with his head cut off, but he doesn't get the main objective of a service business like this which is :

Put the CUSTOMERS first!!!!!

Won't be back here.

This is based on the wifi!! I was traveling and searching for wifi everywhere and was continuously getting let down and becoming depressed. Bc internet is my life. I was ecstatic that i finally found somewhere with not only working wifi but fast too! The wifi here is faster than any other starbucks or public wifi i've ever used!! According to another yelper's tip, the speed has been up to ~33 mpbs download and ~5 mbps upload!

This is the best Mexican Restaurant in the city. I have had the best in Los Angeles and Mexico.
Hands down the best in Pittsburgh. The burritos are amazing with a chipotle salsa. My sister lived her chicken mole enchiladas.

Looking for some place new to try, I came across Pabellon via Yelp. I've driven pasted it several times, but never stopped. After reading several good reviews, I figured why not!? 

The service throughout the experience was top notch. We didn't have to wait long for anything. 

We couldn't decide on Mexican or Venezuelan so we ordered a bit of everything. Chips & salsa, chips & queso, traditional tacos, shredded beef empanadas, reina pepiada, chido burrito and churros (to go!---so full) My favorite was the shredded beef empanadas. So flavor full! 

Oh-did I mention it was BYOB? The server had a bucket ready to go with ice for our drinks as soon as we arrived. 

We will definitely go back. I highly recommend to give Pabellon a shot!
I tried their signature dish, a beef arepa which was delicious. Just the right amount for lunch, but I ordered a flan for dessert which was also tasty. Alejandro, the waiter, was very hospitable.
Oh my, the best Mexican food I have ever eaten!  I am in Mexico frequently, the quality of the ingredients, the authenticity, the freshness puts our friends south of border to shame!
So good. Arepa's are new to me, kind of like a pupusa but even better in my book. This place is for real and the people there are great!

Definitely improved over the previous management!  When it was Bea Taco I ordered a chorizo taco that had maybe a tablespoon of meat.  This place's tacos are overflowing with delicious chorizo.  The choriqueso was wonderful too as was the bacon and yellow cheese empanada.  My only complaint was I ordered my tacos with only beans and rice and they still came loaded with onions and cilantro.  Luckily I was able to pick them off.  Delivery time was reasonable and food arrived still warm.  Overall I definitely recommend this place and will be ordering again!  Prices are a bit high but the food was very filling and I had a couple days worth of leftovers.

I had the Arepa and the Tacozeula. Both very tasty. What set the 5 star was the care the service took in preparing the dish while recommending tweaks based on allergies.
Will go back!
Great little place with really good food (no drinks).  Might be our new 'go-to' dinner place pre-Pens game!  Quick and friendly service as well.

I went in here and the service was a little slow. When I finally got the menu, it was the Mexican menu. I came in to try their Venezuelan food. Unfortunately, the only items that I was able to order were the arepas. I was i formed that if i wanted empanadas i would have to wait longer. 

I decided to get the Pabellon arepa. When I received it, the beans were spilling out of the arepa and the cornmeal which could've been a little more crispy, was soggy. The flavors were present and the arepa was generously filled. I would come back here again to give this place a second chance however, I prefer cilantro et ajo much more then here for Venezuelan cuisine.

We had family in from out-of-town and decided to give this place a chance for take out. Everyone commented that it was the best Mexican food they've had in awhile. We will definitely be ordering more from here.

Super pricey. Super super pricey. But some of the best food in Pittsburgh. You will never have a bad meal ever. But the food is just so grossly overpriced. $20 for a grilled chicken breast and salad is too much. But food is great. And the staff is even better than the food. Always good here. Just please lower the prices

This is by far my favorite place to go when I visit.  I've never had anything bad and absolutely love the servers.  The baked ziti is amazing and you'll get 2 meals out of it.

The Italian sausage is fabulous too.  My favorite are the buffalo chicken wings with their ranch.  Best wings in the area and the ranch is beyond the best.

Classic place.. Best Caesar salad I've ever had, always crunchy and the dressing is so yummy. From the appetizers to the entrees down to the ranch this place will not let you down!! The monthly martini is always delicious too :) and also a great beer selection!! Friendly staff and always leave feeling full and happy !

Simply really good food at great prices. A wide selection of Italian based items are available on their menu. The Penne with Vodka sauce is some of best we have had anywhere. The seafood is always fresh and flavorful. We have also enjoyed their catering for office parties. A great value. They also have housemade desserts and alcohol available, Some of our favorites are the mushroom and brie soup ((yum)), the penne with vodka, chicken with sweet peppers and provolone, the baked stuffed scrod, and all their pasta dishes look amazing. We can't wait to try more in the future, it just hard not to always order our favorites. There is a reason why this place is always busy, so expect a short wait around dinner time and certainly on weekend. But do wait, it is worth it, and I rarely say that about most places.

So let me start off by saying I have eaten here a lot and always had a good experience until last night. We sit down and within two minutes the waitress comes over and asks for our order. Without having time to look at the menu we asked for her to come back in a few minutes. 20 minutes later and empty drinks the waitress took our order. I asked for a side of vegetables and was told they only make enough to serve with the special. I thought this comment was odd because every time I have eaten there and requested them I was not given this answer. We place our order. Didn't ask if we wanted another drink or more water. A few minutes later another staff member came over and quickly got us another drink. The appetizer was brought out with the meals and did not have the extra side of sauce as requested. Finally my salad came with NO dressing. 10 minutes later the waitress appeared with the dressing and side sauce for the appetizer which was extremely cold now. Before she could run away again we asked to order another drink.
Overall I was disappointed and shocked on how bad the service was. It was enough to make me not want to go back. Rude and untimely waitress on a TUESDAY! Can you imagine how it would be on a Friday or Saturday. Apparently you get better service at the bar so if you go sit there.

This was our second choice, arriving here after being told of a 40-minute wait at nearby Primanti Brothers in Mount Lebanon.  We should have stayed there.  We had a more than 30 minute wait at Armstrong's on a weekday night when everyone was apparently enjoying being off from work and school: lots of large parties.  None of the young lady hosts go out of their way to be cordial or welcoming and there is no management in evidence: what a difference it would make if a pleasant individual in charge of the dining room would come over to briefly chat and to assure that the meal was satisfactory.  Our server was delightful: full of personality, charm, and pizzazz.  She did not bring water or bread nor ask us if we wanted either.  I received a glass of water upon request.  I ordered the stuffed chicken breast special.  I should have been tipped off by the reasonable price of $10.50 for the complete dinner that it would not be very substantial, and it was, in fact, the tiniest chicken breast imaginable.  The chicken was mediocre and bland.  Calling this stuffed chicken breast was inaccurate.  The breast was so tiny and flat that it could not have been stuffed with anything.  It was, in fact, chicken breast topped with stuffing.  The stuffing was delicious, including mushrooms, carrots, and zucchini.  The accompanying mashed potatoes and gravy were also very good.  I substituted a side order of french fries for the broccoli that comes with the meal, no additional charge.  The fries were golden brown and tasty, and the portion huge.  I asked for a cup of the soup du jour, cream of mushroom.  I was brought a large bowl.  It was excellent, but not served hot.   The price was a whopping $5.25, which gives me pause as I reflect upon the fact that a large serving of soup is included at an outstanding favorite restaurant of ours, Franco's Trattoria in Peters Township.  My significant other ordered an Italian hoagie: enormous and delicious, filled with a layer of tasty cheese, but pricey at $14.50, which included no side dish or salad.  The tab came to $51 with two draft beers, a generous tip, and with no dessert.  I believe Armstrong's has gotten ahead of itself in boosting prices.  It is comparable in many ways to another nearby neighborhood gem, Pasta Too, but it is significantly more expensive.
Kind of greasy, but it's a unique diner style restaurant.  I enjoy it for fish sandwiches and mac n cheese.

Armstrong's is one of my favorite restaurants! Located in the Caste Village shopping center, you are sure to find parking somewhere near by and I have never had to wait to be seated. The food is delicious and they serve up big portions at a fraction of the cost of other big name restaurants! And if you are ever feeling the desire to go all out, do not hesitate to indulge on one of their amazing desserts! I recently ordered the Heath bar cheesecake and it was amazing- smooth, delicious and full of chocolate and butter toffee flavor. By far, the best cheesecake I've had- better than Cheesecake Factory and much cheaper! The ambiance is great. It's dim indoors usually, unless the sun is shining through the ceiling window. The staff is friendly and the service is great. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a big meal with a reasonable price!

One of my favorite restaurants! Portions are huge! My favorite is the wedding soup with the steak hoagie deluxe. Calzones are enormous and enough for 2 meals! Basically anything there is enough for 2 meals.  You really get what you pay for here.  They've catered events at my work place and it was top notch as always,  highly recommend!
Always a good meal here. The Chicken Romano is yummy. Great Antipasto salads too! Definitely try this one!

I can't review the ACTUAL club, because the rudest front desk person I've ever encountered shouted at us before we could even walk into the room fully that they weren't giving out any more wristbands, whatever that means, and turned us away after we paid half a grand for a suite at this resort. Rudest employee ever, she needs to check herself and realize she is a front desk girl at a club, in a casino, in Arizona. This isn't Vegas sweetie, or L.A. Take your self importance BS to Denny's or Ihop and treat people like crap there who only want $2 eggs. We paid good money to be treated well, this club needs to fire her ASAP. I don't care if it was packed like a sardine can if that was the case she should have politely explained they were at capacity, (although the waiting area was EMPTY no lines or people waiting and the club was supposed to be open almost a whole hour still.) But that is irrelevant. If you go here, avoid the desk girl "Kaylin" if you have any desire to have a decent human being act like we are all equal, not like you are a peasant in her Kingdom of elevator doors. The truth hurts! 270 is a bust.

Went here last Saturday. The atmosphere is nice and drinks are ok. The first DJ had the place going and played Top 40, R&B and hip hop. 2nd DJ (a female) was wack! People started leaving in the beginning and went down to the casino level where there was a lounge playing live music and a DJ. As for the bartenders they were terrible. Took them FOREVER to get the drinks ready for people and I heard one of the females were rude. The manager needs to make sure they are attending to the whole bar section and not just one side. Will I go back again only if the first DJ was there and then I would leave when he did.

This is a pretty cool nightclub!  It's on the 14th Floor of the casino and the view is amazing.  

Here's my thought: I wish this place would be more popular for the younger crowd. My friends I'm not getting any younger myself, but if I'm a club promoter I can't say Degree 270 would be my first choice.  The music is hip and actually very good. Drinks are affordable and plus you have a swanky restaurant upstairs and a casino downstairs - right? Right? Well again the crowd needs to change.  In the end, it's about whose who and why they should go.  I would come to lounge and enjoy the music and view. I'm for sure the people here are A+ people.  This is not your typical club....really it's not. - Enjoy!

degree270 could be a really cool spot, but it's a miss in a lot of ways....

Pros - Amazing views, terraces, open layout, part of the casino

Cons - No cocktail servers, interior is cheaply done, no furniture on the terraces, won't allow you to open the doors because the air conditioning can't compensate, serve cocktails in plastic cups, decent appetizers but not worth the prices.

We have been here many times - not by choice as it is disgusting having to trek through the stench of cigarette smoke to get to the dance floor. While there, you'll quickly regret having shown up. The music could be better, the extremely limited seating is haphazardly placed and the drinks watered down. Get bottled beer if you must.

Worst of all, the restrooms are beyond gross! On busy nights, even the men's room routinely has long lines! Not enough urinals or stalls for the amount of people they let in. Unfortunately, on more than one occasion I have witnessed people relieving themselves on the floor out of frustration from waiting! I've brought it to the attention of a "manager" on the floor but never notice any immediate action taking place. Pretty sad... 

So, go if you must, such as when invited for a birthday gathering or just because there's no other dance floor around, but better (and more sanitary) choices are just an Uber away..

I when to this place last month to celebrate my birthday and I was pretty surprise how good was the music but one thing is for sure drinks r expensive and weak but over all it was a pretty good and fun spot.

Nice view 14th floor, relaxing, good service, great singer/pianist live music.  High prices, all drinks $16, the margarita... Just say no, it is super strong, not in a good way, tastes horrid!  Cheese plate, Cracker/bread too crumbly, falls apart, rest of tray very good.

First off, don't even bother trying this place out. Upon arrival, the club was empty with a few straggler dancers, most likely trashed from some destination wedding. Worst of all, this is the type of bar that measured their shots in drinks they charge $8+ for, and that's well liquor. On top of that, they somehow managed to mess up a drink orders from my friends not once, but twice. This place is a tragedy that needs to be avoided/reimagined/remanaged/SHUT DOWN.

This is a funky little place with great views!! It's a young crowd so if you are 40+ you might want to stay home! However, I went there last night with 9 of my girlfriends and we had a ball! We got there super early so we practically had the club to ourselves! The reason why I'm only giving it 3 stairs is because I don't appreciate not being able to sit anywhere comfortably without having to pay for bottle service! Plus, they gave us attitude because we had our leftovers from Ocean Trail with us! We just wanted to shake our tail feathers and have a nightcap before leaving Talking Stick. Other than that, it was fun!
Horrible. Management always on a high horse. Discrimination in the worst way. If you're looking to hangout and dance with friends - save your time and money, go some place that accepts every one!!
So I came here the other day and omg this place is so damn good ! So worth the money !! Nice dinner date, would absolutely come here again !

Sushi was good; ambiance fitting but service not the best. Our waitress got one of orders of sushi wrong and then after we cancelled the order they still tried to send us another order of sushi which was still wrong. Do not order the fried ice cream. Tastes like its already previously made and warmed.
Yummmmyy! I come here all the time and the food is amazing! Service is good not great but the food makes up for it.

On November 20, 2017 i walked in at 9:55pm and they turned me away saying that they are closed and that they dont take anybody after 10pm even though i was there 5mins early, on top of that their operating hours are until 10:30pm. This place is rudely unprofessional and the person upfront greeting their guests needs to be more polite!

Worst customer service we've ever experienced that we had to sign up for yelp!  
Literally from the beginning, hostess was way overwhelmed, we gave her time to kinda get it together even tho there were 5 empty tables ready, we had a Reservation, and we were early. THE BATHROOM IS A MESSSS! Waitress could care less for her job, way too busy I think she was doing a whole section by herself and it got to a point where we had to call on some random apron wearing guy- who said he couldn't help because he wasn't a waiter, and he called our waitress whooooo called on another waiter to help us. 
Toward the end I had to help my self to the empty to-go boxes to put away our food. Then finally a different waiter took our card and disappeared and then we found out he gave it to the hostess to finalize..... and this was our story of how wel never go to a geisha house restaurant. 
P.s. sushi was aight not worth our 70$ bill. 
Manager retrain your staff. Clean your bathrooms it says a lot about our restaurant. Remind your waiters to clear the dirty dishes for the customers. You're welcome.
We've been here several times but, this time was exceptional. Our Chef this time seasoned our food perfectly. Chef Kenny took him time on each course. We loved our experience today!

I really like Geisha House. The only reason I gave it 4 starts was because of the eel sauce. It tastes like diesel fuel. Not that I've tasted diesel fuel, but it's what I imagine it tastes like. So if you come here make
Sure you order everything without the eel sauce. It was so bad I thought it was rotten. I asked the server about it and she said that they hadn't had any complaints and that eel sauce should be bitter. All the other eel sauce I've ordered is on the sweet side. I couldn't finish the roll. I had to send it back. 

The server was super nice and sent the manager over. She comped that roll and we ordered something else. 

There is never a wait for sushi but there is usually a wait for the tepanyaki grill. So make a reservation for that if that's what you're in to.

One of my favorite sushi places! The lunch special is the absolute best. Miso soup, salad, and either a specialty roll or regular roll all around $11-$15. Services is always great, the servers are friendly. I have been here about six times and everything from the food to service stays great.
Love the food and Service.plan to bring my family and visitors here next time.Will definitely trYSushi next time also

So took a chance on a 3 1/2 stars and just to say we are 1 month new and So Cal(dont hate) and was impressed with the quality and service. I gave 5 stars based on quality, service and ambiance. Hidden gem in the north west. It will be our go to for sushi. Happy hour goes late and full bar!!!! Took a Lyft 5 minutes from the house.

When the name of a place had Wine House in the title, expectations are that the wine selection would be top notch.  

I was surprised to find 1/4 of their retail space dedicated to pre-made gift baskets covered in dust, wine knick knacks, wooden baskets, and other gift like items for the home.  I'm not coming to a Wine House to buy jam or pepper spread, I'm coming to buy wine, so why would I want dusty pre-made baskets that look like there from the 1970's?

After passing by the gift basket area, the wine selection was mainly just against one wall.  The organization of the wine was lacking and I was annoyed that in order to find the price I needed to pick up every bottle and try to read the hand written chicken scratch on the back of each bottle.  We are in the 21st century and price tags seem appropriate especially when trying to find wine that would fit my budget.  I found myself picking up $20 bottles as well as $100 bottles just trying to find something with the price point I wanted.  

One glance in our direction and one could easily assess that we were first time shoppers at the store.  Two men were in the middle of the store behind the counter talking to each other and never once offered to help with the store layout or offering up any wine recommendations.  It's not often I can say that no one offered to assist me but it's true at Rozi's Wine House.  

Most of their space was dedicated to a decent beer selection on the other side of the room.  As Cara L. stated "They should change the name to Rozi's Beer House".  You could even create your own Six Pack with the variety of bottles laid out on the shelves.  We opted to create our own after seeing the abysmal wine selection and chose six local Colorado Beers (prices written on the back of the bottles).  

I expected a lot more from a family run operation, in wine selection and customer service.
Friendly and very informative. Can get a big selection and even will order wine for you they dont have!! I feel this place is a must go for wine and beer drinkers!
This place rocks. You can sit, get a beer or some wine, and chill out. Their baked Brie is also absolutely excellent and our server let us sample a bunch of on tap beers before we made our choice.

This is a great spot for beer in Lakewood, and much more affordable than some competitors. I love the patio and the taps where you can sample/drink to your heart's content.

I've seen some beers here I haven't seen elsewhere and the selection seems pretty special. I like how they also have a wide variety in the fridge just in case you don't feel like putting a bottle in the freezer in order to enjoy it that night.

For it being a "Wine House," though, their wine selection looks a little weak. I haven't seen anything out of the ordinary or spectacular here. In fact, the shelves look a little bare.

But, being as I'm not a wine connoisseur, that is okay with me! I'll stick to the basics and be experimental with the beer instead.
I love Rozis.  I come here at least once a week.  I do the  special beer samplings they have.  I just cannot take how hot HOT it is in this place.  Turn the heat down and lets drink some beer!

Great Lakes rep lamenting (in a friendly way) my choosing to buy Storm King Imperial Stout over any of his offerings?  Check.  Large cold case full of a range of friendly, delicious Belgian and Trappist ales?  Check.  Rochefort 10 specifically?  Check.  Typical pricing on all of these wonderful but pricey beers?  Check.  Not that I could even hope to ever find fine fermented delights on the cheap, but one can dream.
I originally came to Rozi's due to the fact that they, like many Cleveland-area and regional wine shops, carry a fine assortment of ice wines.  Gradually, as my imbibing horizons widened, I came to realize that their beer selection is pretty healthy, as well.  Outside of the previously noted (and celebrated, celebrated, celebrated) Belgian and Trappist imports, they also carry a wide variety of domestics and micro-brews (as well as home-brewing supplies, if you're into that sort of thing).  It's the kind of wine/beer shop that, if it was in my hometown, I'd probably spend a pretty decent amount of time in, perusing the shelves and trying many a new brew.
A pretty decent little shop with a pretty decent selection.  "Pretty decent" works across the board as a description for Rozi's, actually - not the best place I've ever been to, but clean, with friendly, knowledgable staff who will let you roam in peace, and Rochefort 10.  Did I mention that already?  Oh, I certainly did.  There's just got to be a distinctive reason.  Go try a bottle already.

From the outside, they're rated in the top 30 of best beer selection in the world ?! Yeah, right, I thought. 

Well, they're right, this is probably the best beer selection that I've seen in Cleveland, and is a close second that I've ever seen, next to Tiffany's in Kalamazoo, Michigan. 

However, this honor is for the the quality of their beer selection not the quantity. This is a beer snob's beer store. If you appreciate beer more than just bud and miller, then Rozi's is for you. 

While the quantity of beers that they have is not very large - about at least 6 to 8 coolers, their beer selection, primarily beers from Europe, including special sections devoted to Belgians and Russians, is a sight to behold. There's even a devoted shelf for sour beers. I agree with Murray, the number of beers there is may be less than Simone's but there's more rarer beers here. You can also buy singles here as well, breaking up the six-packs, score. 
In addition to their European beers, there's a large selection of microbrews from the USA and Mexico, including founders, Stone, dogfish, left hand, Buckeye, and a full line of Goose Island [I didn't know Goose Island makes special four packs].
There's also a selection of home brewing supplies including yeasts, hops, bottle caps, and buckets. 

They also sell kegs of microbrews *******note to future CM: keep this in mind for future elite events, thanks **********  if you ever want to binge drink in style. 

I spent a good 20-30 minutes in here without even looking at their wine, which makes up over half of the store.

It's September, which means Halloween officially starts for me yesterday. I rode the hog(huffy) down to the library for some spooky cd's and stopped by Rozi's for pumpkin or autumnal beer. Ended up getting the Brooklyn Oktoberfest and Post Rd pumpkin(also Brooklyn). Yeah, they're not exactly the rarest of beers to find, but the location and saving a trip to the superhellhole really made my day. Just the browsing itself was awesome. They have Joe Charbonneau beer. For those not in the know, he was a Cleveland Indians star in the making, then just sucked after his rookie year. That and other local brews are for sale. Most of the stuff was too rich for my blood alcohol. Lots of American micro-brews, not so many imports. Simone's is the place for imports.

The staff was way friendly, even to a scruffy looking dude with a backpack. Said backpack was used to carry all the goodness home papoose-style on my lap so none of it fell out all over Warren rd. Did i mention it's almost Halloween? So stoked. But it never lasts long enough.

Fantastic beer and wine selection.  With the recent addition of taps and year-round "patio" seating, you can do all your beer shopping and while sampling some great craft selections.  The people are super nice and extremely helpful.

The store maybe called Rosie's Wine, but the store offers tons of different types of alcohol. My personal favorite was the cider selection. Usually, when I go to the store I find a couple of ciders; however, at the store they have a large selection.

 The other nice benefit is that the store has a build your own beer container. So you can mix and match different types of beer. This is really great if you want to either try something new or you don't know what you like. I really enjoyed mixing and trying new beer.

 The only thing I would note is that it is a bit difficult to find the price of the drink. The store has most of the tags written on the drink with a pen. This caused me to walk out with a $12 beer that I ended up hating. 

This store was great overall and I intend to go back

Decided to take the family here for our weekly Takeout Tuesday. I've orders takeout from  here years and years ago but never dined in. The Groupon was only for dine in. The food was really good. I sampled some of everybody's which is why I don't know what I had an allergic to. Ughhhhh. About 30 minutes to an hour later once I reached home I started itching profusely and then came the welps and bumps. Luckily I had some Benadryl on hand(life of a Mom). Hopefully I'm not getting any food allergies in my "old" age. But overall imtge food was good. Family loved it. It was really empty tonight, maybe about 10 people including my 4 but hey it's a Tuesday right??!!!! And Tuesday's are all about Tacos...maybe next Tuesday I'll stick to Tacos

We really appreciated the fast and friendly service from the staff.  Also, the owners came to the table to make sure everything was good.  They took the time to chat for a minute.The food we ordered was so delicious.  My favorite is the beef with broccoli and the wonton soup.  This is the perfect place for a large group of people.  There are rooms in the back where you can have privacy, and the main dining area is also very nice, with a really beautiful aquarium. My family and I always enjoy coming here for Chinese food.
First time here, so I gave them 4 stars. Excellent service, food very good , great atmosphere!
Won't be back. Below average food. Great service. Shrimp was tough and tasteless. Cashews were stale.

We have been coming here for several years and the service and food varies to the day of the week and server. Week days are best, quick and attentive service. Shrimp in chili sauce is one of our favorite but the spiciness varies each time. Flower chicken is good if you like more on the bland side. Pork fried rice is consistently good just wish they could add spouts. Overall this is a fine restaurant

We didn't eat the food here because we arrived, ordered, and saw a cockroach crawling around the bowl of the crunchy noodles that they serve as a table item. When we attempted several times to flag down a waiter - who apparently wasn't OUR waiter - he ignored us. Our waitress came to apologize that he was ignoring us because our table isn't in his area. So we still have a cockroach hanging out at our table. The manager came out to ask about the situation and did not apologize and did not offer any compensation. We left and recommend you not patronize this place.

My wife's favorite. Food is top notch and fresh for Chinese.  They have a Sunday buffet that is amazing.  We don't normally like buffets but they have great fresh food. Always have a great meal here.  More pricey than others but you get what you pay for.

I'm not sure if the folks are reviewing the same restaurant that I have enjoyed since 1985. I live in Florida now but come back to Charlotte 4-5 times a year and the Great Wall is always a must destination. 
My order is always the same and it is always delicious- Great Wall Special Trio; spicy, no vegetables. Fried Rice and Hot & Sour soup.
We have not been able to find good Chinese in North Florida. We would be so happy if we could get Chinese food the caliber of Great Wall!

I came here with my in-laws to celebrate Father's Day. My Mother-In-Law called ahead and was told we could reserve the private room in the back. When we got there we were told that her name was mixed up with another woman, and that we would have to be seated in the main dining room. Not a big deal, but when you're told one thing and get another it's not the best way to start a meal. 

We ordered the crispy scallion pancakes, which were very good as an appetizer, and you get crispy noodles and sweet sauce for the table. I got the chicken lo mein for my dinner. Everyone else's food including mine, looked great, except for my sister-in-law. She was trying to be healthy and ordered tofu. Thinking she would get some vegetables, she didn't ask what else it came with. Let me tell you, it was only tofu, in some sort of brown sauce. It did not look very appetizing. 

I thought for the  amount people that were there, it took a little long to get our food, but once it came out I was more than happy. We were also able to use a restaurant.com gift card, but also know that the tip is added before you pay when you use one. 

Another great family dinner with the in-laws.
During the first seven years I lived in Charlotte, I had lunch here at least three times a month.  The food and service has always been steady.  I always left feeling as though I received good value

The freshest sushi you will ever eat. Among other things, we got the salmon and tuna rolls and they were unbelievable.  The service was prompt and the server was very knowledgeable. My cocktail was also outstanding!

Excellent waiter and service. Food was exceptional. If you like sashimi the chefs selection is great and beautifully presented. We loved the ribs which had good flavor and fell off the bones the curry dish I thought was okay and would try another item next time. The curry had too much of a turmeric flavor for my taste. The spicy crab legs were good but a lot of spicy mayo and probably wouldn't get that again.

One of the best restaurants I've had the chance to go to in Vegas. We picked a variety of sushi sashimi and makis, which came progressively. Everything is really tasty and freshly made on the spot. The wine list is great, and they offer amazing Japanese beer.
You will have to make a reservation even during the week. 
Would be a 5* if service wasn't so pushy. We felt like we were disappointing the server when we picked our own choices instead of his recommendations.

A wonderful dining experience. 'it was truely a magical experience when dining at Iron Chef's Morimoto's signature restaurant. Located in the MGM.

Loved everything..

The best black cod I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, flaky and moist, delicious miso sauce. Quite rich- the one piece on the plate was enough. Also tried the basmati rice with duck and egg on the side, but that was underseasoned. Had morimoto's sake from his own label and it was really good, smooth. Presentation was neat with the carafe in an ice bowl. Now, the highlight: their flaming chocolate marshmallow ball. This desert plate is massive and probably good for 2-3 people. Indulgent.

The restaurant itself is new to Vegas and is on the side of the hallway in MGM. On a Thursday night it was really busy. Staff were attentive and friendly and never intrusive. I kind of wish I saw Morimoto himself, but he may have been in the other area of the restaurant. Great experience.

The food was great!  Morimoto is a sushi master.  My family and I tried a wide range of his dishes and everything was superb.  Try the fried whole fish, it was my favorite.  I also really liked the chef's choice sushi platter.

Morimoto is a master of his craft and it is reflected at his newest restaurant at the MGM. The end-to-end experience was hands down the best dining experience I've had in Vegas. Everything from the top-notch service by our waiter Truman to the execution of Morimoto's signature dish the Buri Bop made this restaurant a must. The toro maki roll was the best sushi I've ever had, the fatty tuna just melted in your mouth. The restaurants Sommelier even stopped by to find the best sake pairing with the meal I had. 5 stars! I will be back.

Morimoto was an amazing experience! We went here on a Sunday night around 9:45.  We waited 15 minutes to be seated.  
We followed the waiter's recommendation of one appetizer and one entree per person to share with the table.  
We had the beef carpaccio, short ribs and rock shrimp tempura.  All three dishes were delicious! My favorite app was the beef carpaccio. 
For dinner, we ordered the pork belly bib bim bap (this was cooked at the table), the black cod and the rock fish.  The rock fish came whole and was so tender.  The black cod was extremely flavorful and was my favorite main dish. The bib bim bap was probably the best I've ever had.  
We also ordered a couple cocktails, which were good, but the food was the showcase of our experience.  
High recommend Morimoto!

For a Japanese restaurant I was surprised to find all kinds of Asian food on the menu, including Korean bibimbap styled hot stone bowl and some Chinese flavored dish. Since it's a Japanese restaurant I tried to stick to the Japanese dishes like the chirashi, chef's combination sushi, soft shell crab roll and Hamachi kama. The fish was pretty fresh but the fish in my chirashi was cut into various random shapes which makes me feel like they are using scrap fish. 

Service was great and they were speedy with our order since we were time crunched to go to a show.

However the flavor and the expectations of a Japanese restaurant weren't met for me. I really wish they would stick to their own cuisine.

Was in Vegas last week and 2 of our dinners were at Morimoto's! Asked specifically for Jeffery as our waiter both times - he is the best!  He helped pick out a sake for me last year - he is friendly and knowledgable, ask for him when you go!

We've had all sorts of things off the menu:
- tuna pizza: unique and worth trying out
- duck confit rice: tasty
- japanese wagyu sushi: lightly seared 
- uni: creamy and delicious
- assorted sushi and rolls: enjoyed them all
- fiery chocolate tart: fun to watch and delicious to eat
- vanilla donut holes: interactive and delicious as well

It can be a bit pricey but we enjoyed the food and our time there. 
Looking forward to going back.

Not sure how this place stays in business..before yelping I always try out a place a few times to give it a fair review. This place has now burnt my food all 3 times. Sent back on last visit and got only marginally improved food. Omelette was burnt, bacon burnt and greasy. Toast overcooked..how the heck do you screw up toast in a diner! Over priced, lousy food, I'm done with this place.
Very good and consistent restaurant.  We often have breakfast here and the staff are very friendly.  A decent coffee as well.
Great spot.  Moderate pricing. Great Swiss mushroom burger. Staff friendly and service is great.

MUCH improved over a couple of years ago. 
Great breakfasts!
We had delicious veggie skillet and veggie Benedict's.
Pretty good aside from a few pieces of black lettuce in my salad that should not have been there.  The food tasted fresh and good.

We were driving around the summit and saw the diner. Thought we would give it a try. When we walked in, no one smiled and said welcome or anything. We sat at the bar. The server came up, didn't introduce herself, and just said " what do 
you want to drink", that was it.

We ordered food, which was good, a little pricey and the presentation was lacking. It looked like the food was just thrown on the plate. 

I will give it a second try to check out their breakfast, but if the service and presentation stay the same, we will probably not come back. 

I hope the place heeds some advice from its customers. It's nice to have something local at the summit.

I love this place. Super clean. I have been here for breakfast with my husband or for lunch with co workers and I just love this place. No matter what you get their portion sizes are huge and service is always excellent.
I've been for lunch a few times and the service and food has been good.  I will continue to go.

Food was mediocre and very over priced. Worse of all, there was no friendly diner atmosphere. Customers, staff and owners ignored my husband and I, even when we told them we were new to the area. We will never go back.
.

Okay this place is small and has cute decor, nice outside seating area that's dog friendly. The food I would have to say is okay, nothing wowed me and some dishes were a little bland. The waitresses were really friendly and helpful and honest which I liked. The turkey on my Benedict was really tasty and I love the hash browns. Overall it's a good diner food place.

Was curious about this place as I travel to this area quite a bit.  Decided on a Wednesday night to go in and grab a bite.  I was a bit surprised that a 'steakhouse' had a rundown irish bar feel to it.

I asked for a wine menu and was unimpressed by the selections.  I ordered the house merlot.  It was not good.  I also ordered the French Onion soup.  That was good.  The service, however, was slow.  I don't think the bartender was behind the bar more than 1/3 of the time I sat there.

There were only about 15 or so people in the restaurant, but, I'm warning you, that this place is uncharacteristically LOUD.  I'm not sure why the acoustics are what they are, but my ears are still ringing.  

Then 3 'regulars' strolled in and started yapping it up.  Further, they decided to play lewd videos on one of their phone's with the volume cranked up.  Nice.  Thanks for exhibiting sheer narcissism and complete disregard for anyone around you!  One person in the party starts telling a story about his friend in Vegas and how this friend kept yelling "hey fatso".  The worse part was the guy telling the story actually yelled it at the bar.  Seriously, wtf!?!?!?

I had planned on dinner and another glass of wine, but had to cut bait and beat feet out of there asap.  Too many reasons to leave.  And too many other restaurants in the area to be back.

This is my favorite steakhouse. It was so inconspicuous that I almost didn't try it, but I was glad I stopped in earlier this year. The steak, salad, and service are great! I have been multiple times since my first visit and never disappointed. During my most recent visit I didn't enjoy the Ribeye as much as I usually do, but they more than made up for it with thoughtful management, and top notch service. I appreciated them taking time to get my feedback on what was less satisfying. I'll be back!

My first time here and not impressed at all. The place was pretty full being that it was Friday night. It is one of those experiences that are just okay. The server wasn't bad but she wasn't good either (no personality). The service was slow though. It took a long time for our dinners to come. I ordered the beef brisket and pulled pork dinner (14.99). Both the brisket and pork had good flavor but arrive cold at my table. The brisket was tender enough to be cut with the fork but the portion was too small for the price. Ditto for the pork. Not sure was was special about the chef's rice either as it was a bit bland and like a saffron rice. The corn muffins were okay but had to ask for them twice before getting them. I seriously do not think I'll be going back to this one.

I thought the food was great and the service was good.  Our hostess and bartender were both very nice and accommodating.   Burger and soup was delicious and had plenty for leftovers.  Happy hour from 3-6!
Great French onion soup! But the Bbq sauce I was not a fan of. Will be back and try something different.

AWFUL. I ordered a sirloin, which, granted, isn't the best cut of steak. However, I ordered it medium, knowing that most restaurant sirloins at this level of doneness are still juicy and tasty. WRONG. This steak came to me as a dry, thin, inedible piece of leather. I ate a small portion of it before my jaw got tired of gnawing at it, and gave up. I went to Applebee's (yes, The 'Bees) the next day to get one of their $10 sirloins to cleanse my palate of the Austin's steak that cost several dollars more. The only reason I didn't send it back is because I was paying with a Groupon. 

Just awful. Don't waste your time or money, and especially don't be tempted with Groupon offers.

About a year ago we were on line looking for a Sunday Brunch. Austins boasted the best brunch around for only $10. We decided to check it out. When we got there we were told that they were no longer doing a Sunday Brunch. We said ok and decided to stay and have off the menu brunch.  We ordered a bottle of Champagne (what is brunch without Champagne) and again we were told that it was no longer on the menu and all they had was M&R Asti. We left.  A while later we bought a Restaurant.Com coupon. We finally decided to use it and headed off to Austins. When we got there we were told that the coupon had expired. (they don't) The manager explained to us that that they had done a contract with Restaurant.com to expand their customer base. I did not make sense not to honor the coupon because we were there to expand their customer base. What difference did it make as to when we decided to use the coupon. We decided to leave which amazed the manager. I can't actually review the restaurant because we never have eaten there. I can only say that if you have a Restauran.com coupon they will not honor it and also don't look at the menu because it is never right.

UNBELIEVABLE! The worst restaurant experience EVER. We went last night (Saturday) around 8:00, past the rush. We took  quite a while to look at the menu, and when we were ready to order we had to flag down another waitress before ours woke up and took our order. After the food arrived  no one ever came back to see if we needed anything, or if our 26.00 steaks were OK, or to remove our salad plates. The manager walked past us several times without a glance, to go to the bar to check on the basketball game on TV, or to chat with the girls around the bar. When we finished, no one brought the check, even though the bartender could clearly see us. We slid our dirty dishes to the end of the table, hoping that someone would notice that we were done. Nope. I finally asked the bartender for the manager. At this point I was just mad, and it got worse when he denied walking past us and, I kid you not, started YELLING AT ME. This went on for a while, in front of other diners. At least we finally got our check. It was my husband's birthday. I'd give zero stars if I could.

Sad to say but I ordered the burger and within 20 minutes of eating it, had wicked stomach cramps, felt very hot, and vomited in the restaurant's bathroom.  Everyone else at the table was fine...they ordered the strip steak and the ribs.  Their fries are good so that was the bright spot in the dinner.

I have been to many restaurants,But this by far is the worst place i have ever step foot in,the staff was unpleasant,if they had a manager he was no where to be found,we waited for over a hour to be seated and the hostess seems like they was doing us a favorite by coming to this dump of a restaurant ,the food was lousy my husband ribs, was burnt and he sent them back and when they return they just throw sauce on and re heated in a microwave ,and the bill was not cheap over a $100.00 dollars .I will never recommend this place to no one.

Giving 5 Stars to Total Wine & More in Boca Park is an easy decision and it won't be hard for me to explain why...because I have so many things to talk about.

Massive Selections! Wine, Liquor, and Beer! There is no where else in town that you can find as many quality bottles of Whiskey...or Tequila...or Rhone Blends...or Sour Beers, et cetera, et cetera.

The store is always well organized and clean. Customer Service is consistently excellent! Every staff member has a Total Wine shirt on and is easy to spot. Many of the staff are quite knowledgeable about the products of the store, but they all are able to point you to an expert if you need more refined help.

They have some of the best prices around, and if that's not enough, I recently saw a sign saying they will match any competitor's price...You can even do some one-stop shopping for snacks as well. Really, what's not to love?

I've been a big fan of Total Wine & More in Boca Park for many years.  I first came in because of its proximity to my residence, but I kept coming back because of the above-and-beyond service I've received over the years. I greatly appreciate that they offer classes and tastings to educate customers in everything from wine to beer to spirits, often including food pairing suggestions as well. There is certainly a lot they are doing right at Total Wine & More!

-2017 review #61-

When I first came here, I thought I died and came to heaven. I am a huge wine fanatic.  There are lanes and lanes of wines.  Come here for anything related to wine.  There is also an interesting beer selection.  Best thing is if you don't find what you like, you can always email them and they'll order it for you.  Price is ok, but I come here for enjoyment and service.  Coming here is like going to a 5 zagat restaurant. The workers are dressed as waiters in an upscale restaurant.  Store is gorgeous. I love coming here for Christmas shopping as well.  I also enjoy online shopping on their website.

Always a great place to go when you're searching for hard to find items. Irish Mist, for example, is not always easy to find for some odd reason.  This place almost always has it along with great selections of beer and wine.

Great gift ideas here as well and ask the staff for their recommendations as well.

This place has a few superlatives going for it. It's got a great selection. The prices seem pretty darn good too. And while those two things go far in my book, it's one last superlative that really gets under my skin:

The customer service is atrocious. 

I think because the workers know that people will always love imbibing alcohol, and that they have a great selection, then they don't have to actually work more than necessary and certainly not have to care about customer service at all. 

I find it odd that many of the floor workers didn't make any eye contact. I prefer to shop alone until I'm ready but when I am, I'd like to be able to find someone easily. 

It seemed that when I was there, the only one who had help was the lady who had a large party that required cases and cases. 

And don't even get me started with the cashiers. A skinny blonde woman was snooty  and short with me when I asked about buying a wine crate. Sorry. Did I bother her by asking her to do her job? And the cashiers closed and opened registers at will as if there were no customers waiting. Maybe her blood sugar was getting low and she was in danger of actually avoiding diabetes. No ma'am, please take that Twinkie break lest you fall below the obese categorization. 

I guess people will always need to get their drink on. But I'm sure this place could find people who actually know how to provide customer service. I mean if BevMo! can do better, why can't TWM? 

I guess I should only come there drunk so I won't care about the zombies collecting a paycheck.
Good selection but it seems like the people at the register are not trained well so it took a long time to check out.

Stuff is always scattered and not in the same place or put in the incorrect area.

Or they're always out of the basic stuff such as Jack Daniels. 

50% of the time they have what I need and if not then I end up having to go to Lee's liquor in the same shopping center I don't know why I bother coming here anymore.

Customer service is nice but their app along with their website is always incorrect as far as what is in stock and what is not.

Obviously 5 stars!  I've actually been meaning to write a review that actually had substance, because based on selection alone I would give 5 stars.

I wanted to do a craft beer advent calendar for my husband.  My brother has a ton of advice on these, so I went in and took pics of their craft beer selection.  He is a doll and took a couple days to decide which beers to get (selecting good beers, some pricier than others, knowing I needed 25 bottles or cans so I wouldn't spend my life savings).

On Dec 1, 2014, I went into Total Wine (with my 2-year-old in tow) and frantically looked for the beers on my list.  Okay.  There are a million beers.  Not knowing what the bottles or cans looked like made this task impossible!  I found a Total Wine beer guy and showed him my phone list and he grabbed them one by one and filled my cart.  Score!

There was only one beer they had run out of by the time I went in, so the beer guy gave me another suggestion.

5 stars for selection, 5 stars for service.  My hubby was SUPER surprised.

Huge selection and the people inside were all nice, like seriously smiles and that kinda thing. When I couldn't figure out how to find what my dad wanted, a specialist came and gave me recommendations. They were good and matched the cheap prices (as much as possible) of the original wine I was trying to find! Much cheaper than buying wine at target!

My two vices in life are wine and cheese. This store has turned one of my addictions into an obsession too! I don't know which is worse, the money I can (and do) blow here, or the time... 
It's likely you've already been to one of their locations, but personally as a wine aficionado, walking in here is like dying and going to heaven! Free sampling on various days, free weekly wine tastings and classes on wine, beer & spirits - how does an adult beverage drinker not frequent this place??

One of my favorite features are the notes listed with most wines. You can see the point rating if applicable (FYI - the higher the number the better the wine), not only that but you can read the tasting notes to get a sense of the flavors, perfect for finding new wines you want to try.

Whether you are shopping for wine, liquor or beer, their prices are competitive and their selection is unmatched. Still can't find what you're looking for? They'll order it for you!

Their tequila and sake selections are the best I've found in the valley, they have every beer you can imagine (tons of Rogue), and I've found other gems here such as: Slim Bob & Skinny Chick's original margarita mix ($6.99) - it's so tasty and only 15 calories a serving (before spirits added of course)!

The sell great gift items, stemware (Ridel baby), and treats like blueberry yogurt covered pretzels *YUM*! And don't miss their extensive mini bottle collection! The staff is always friendly and helpful, the checkout lines are never long, and the store is HUGE! Note: Join their email list to get exclusive offers and notices on sales.

Used to be awesome, new website is horrible for special orders, keg selection on hand has dropped significantly & prices for a 1/2 keg of anything mildly interesting have all gone up 30-$50 for no apparent reason other than maybe paying for horrible new website? Things are going downhill. still there in a pinch but now prefer to shop elsewhere. :(

Came in through the drive thru and ordered my food they told me to wait at one of the stations for my fries I waited for 21 minutes I went inside and had to show them my receipt to get my food and they tried to keep my receipt I demanded my receipt back and the manager told me next time I come in they'd give me a free meal for the wait honestly I would've liked a complete refund cause thanks to them I almost lost my job thank you McDonald's

3rd time is a charm... or in this case, THE END. Never again. My family just moved to Surprise. We have given this location 3 times to give us something OTHER THAN STALE FOOD...AND THEY JACKED THE PRICES UP! 

No matter what time of day you go, you will get the same result! All fried items such as fries, fish filets, chicken nuggets, etc... have been sitting around all damn day. Then when you pull in and order it, they drop it back in the fryer and send it out. 

I used to manage a McDonald's (in high school) and I've seen this happen before. Only at my store a manager would have been fired. At this store, the manager is the one handing out the food. Unacceptable! $40 in the trash and a family having to buy dinner a second time some place else tonight. Thanks a lot. You won't see us back again.
Often use this place for breakfast...but not if the drive-through line is long... Love the sausage biscuit with egg and the coffee, too. Service is friendly.

I will not be a customer of this location again. Every time I come ice cream machine is always down. It's dirty to point of being afraid to sit on a seat and getting stuck. Employees are rude and really don't care except if it about their personal life

Very disappointing.  My family rarely eats fast food, but a couple of times a year I will take my son to a fast food place as a treat. We went through the drive thru and it took about 40 minutes. I live around the corner. We got home and his burger was cold, not even luke warm and the meat was very stiff and stale. The fries were also cold and very cold. We were not given even one napkin.
Worst customer service and un friendly environment Mc Donalds I've ever been in. All other Employees ignore that I was there and needed something never coming back to this location what a shame

I eat at McDonalds....I grew up on happy meals :)  Every so often I feel like having the Mcdonald fries(when I am having my cheat meal).

In review of this Mcdonalds I sometimes avoid this one and go to another so I can enjoy my fries and food!  This is the closest one to my house, but when I have a McDonalds craving I would like to have "good" McDonalds.  
I want salty, lightly greased fries, this McDonalds always lacks salt, dry fries, and most of the time they are give me luke warm fries.  By the time I get home, the fries are cold?  I live within a mile of this one!  If you are looking to enjoy some McDonalds fries this McDonalds never seems to get the taste right and I avoid it when I get that craving..... If you want salt less fries, cold buns on your burger visit this McDonalds.
Super dirty  !!!!!!  The play area was filthy but the staff is very nice and friendly

Everytime I go to this McDonald's there is a long wait. The drive thru takes forever b today I decided to go inside and just as worse. One cashier. Decided to do the order and check yourself out but it doesn't accept payment so after you try and avoid the line it tells you to go to an open register which there is only one with the long line. THEN the payment system for paying with your phone didn't work so luckily I had my wallet with my actual card there. The staff is aware of the wait as they usually say "sorry about the wait". On a Saturday at noon, you should have 2 people at the register.
This is by far one of the worst McDonald's Restaurants I have ever been to. Prices are higher than other McDonald's, service is slow, always under staffed and the food is hit and miss.

Liked the cheese crisp --it was truly crispy.  The salsa was fresh. The fajita quesadilla was amazing!  The quesadilla veggies were cooked just right, they used grilled chicken instead of pulled chicken and the jalapeño cream cheese was delicious!  Service was excellent.  Got there just after 10 PM for a late dinner date with my hubby, and they didn't hassle us for coming in at that time and ordering a full dinner, even with the restaurant closing at 11.  We were out the doors by 10:50.  Will go back again.

Margaritas aren't very strong and they're kind of a rip off.

First walked into the restaurant with my group and one of the hostesses named Jacqueline gave us very condescending looks. When we ask for a booth looked over to her co-workers like it was a joke and continue to talk to us in a condescending way. We went to the first table she acted like she didnt know what she was doing leaving us hanging and just looking around smiling. It was so bad that I had to ask if she was new and I found out that she wasn't. This is very unprofessional and childish.
Tried to eat here.  Despite sixteen open tables there was a twenty minute wait.  When I asked the manager about this he was very rude so we left.  We will not be back.
Food and price were very good. My wife and I could not have had a better server than Erica. Definitely will be coming back   Look for their lunch specials great deals

Went to this place for a girls night out. Made sure to get there at 5:30 so we could take advantage of their happy hour. When we ordered our drinks and food we told our waiter that we wanted The largest margarita they had that was on the happy hour. he said that was great and then asked us what type of tequila we wanted in each drink. We each told him our tequila choices. We sat there for about 3 1/2 to 4 hours eating and drinking and having a good time. Got our checks and were horrified that each of our margaritas were $15!! How did the price go from what was supposed to be $5 a drink to $15. When we confronted the waiter he said we got premium alcohol, so they weren't happy hour. We were floored. If picking out your tequila was extra, he should have never asked us!! We told him we wanted happy hour margaritas from the very beginning. We got the manager involved and he basically said that there must have been a misunderstanding but he was standing behind the pricing. Really?! Then when  questioned if premium alcohol was on happy hour he said it was $2.50 a shot. If that was the case, I could have accepted the $5 margarita charge with $2.50 for the extra shot of premium tequila. Where $15 came from is BEYOND me. Horrible customer service. We were pretty vocal about our upset (some of us got multiple drinks). He later came back to try and redeem himself and said he would take 20% off the entire bill. It was better than nothing, but we won't be going back. I still paid $5 more than I should have. Great way to ruin a wonderful night for us!
Great food! Good service and close to San Tan! My family will be back for sure. They took a while on my plate but comped it without me asking, can't ask for more than that.

Food was good, but hard to find anything not so spicy. This gringo does not like to have a mouth full of fire. Even something that was listed without any peppers (their measure of how hot, none being less hot, 4 being fire) I was hurting afterwards. Oh well, service was good and food was good otherwise.

Dorothy was the best server I have had in awhile in many restuarants polite, acccomodating, just a good person. 
The bacon shrimp appetizers where delicious, however the shredded beef street tacos lacked flavor. and the meat watery and cold. My adult son enjoyed his tamale plate and it looked well made.
For the service I am giving Dorothy the four stars and the food 3. She made the difference on whether I would return.

This place is great there bartender is on point the food is alway great need to tip your people's and next time they just may remember you and what you like that is how it work please people be nice. The food is so fresh love it

Didn't get to try the food since we didn't even get to see our server. No water or chips offered. Waited for 20 mins. and decided to leave. Told reception about it only said oh, I'm sorry. So yeah, we're probably won't be eating there for a while.

Pretty good food, tge vegetables are very crispy which I love! Shows they aren't over cooked and drenched in sauce!

The only downside is the place is small so during the lunch rush there isn't too much room and it gets awkward trying to eat while someone is standing next to you and watching you eat.

The staff is friendly and efficient. The food can be made healthy.  I think its way better tasting than panda.

I LOVE this place. The staff is so amazing and friendly. Especially Marlene, she's so nice and I love talking to her. The food is so good I love the salmon bowls and Pepper steak as well! I love how you can do a low carb option and substitute the rice for veggies. And they have ChinaMist iced tea which i love! There aren't to many places that are quick and have actual healthy options. 5 stars all the way!

Solid healthy meal was enjoyed at this location. The large bowl was only $7 and the white meat chicken was very good quality and was plentiful. Needed an extra teriyaki sauce, but will get that next time. Could use more veggies, but overall a great choice.

I love Samurai Sam's! I really like how it is fresh, yummy, AND healthy! I really like the options and the customization of my order. I recommend the Yakima soba with steak or shrimp. Pot stickers are also on point.

Also, this location has the most wonderful owner, Marlene. It is a family owned business, and they take pride in getting to know their customers. They have memorized my order and always ask how my family is doing. GREAT customer service!
Not horrible.  Get the sauce on the side so you can meter it's overuse.

After reading Lindsey's review, I had to think twice about my original review of this place. Yes, I had been back and gave it another shot.

Yes, perhaps, I was a bit douchy in my prior review. 

This place is definitely a great spot if you need a quick lunch, and you are on the go. Its a fairly comfortable place to eat, and it's better for you than a Baconator (although, that does sound delicious right about now).

They tend to water down their Sriracha, but it might be more of a heat thing rather than a cost cutting thing. Sriracha can be a bit spicy for some.

The spicy chicken bowl is the way to go. Try it. Don't listen to my old review. I was probably having a bad day at work.

If I lived closer, I would eat here multiple times per week! This place is the truth!!

The chicken bowls are excellent, regardless of whether or not you do white or dark meat. HOWEVER, the steak dishes are THE BEST things on the menu...strictly because of the quality of the steak. Most teriyaki joint use reconstituted shoe leather for their steak dishes (or at least it seems that way based on how tough that "steak" usually is!). Samurai Sam's uses true steak (flank steak if I had to wager a guess) and its honestly cooked to perfection! It's thick cut and extremely flavorful. 

Spicy Steak and Pepper Bowl is my go to but any combo of meat, veggies, rice and sauce is going to be a winner. 

Pot stickers are great, egg rolls are not bad and price is definitely right. 

The staff is almost always very friendly and the place is cleaned and maintained very well. Call ahead pick up orders are the way I usually do it and the buy 9 get one free punch card is a must.

ENJOY!
