I'm utterly disappointed again that a McDonald's worker doesn't even seem to have the simple capability of pushing the sweet tea button instead of the regular tea button and even then, brew a regular tea correctly (I believe they switched the sweet tea and regular tea around but even then, the tea was gross). Going home now to spend at least $2.16 in sugar packets to sweeten this baby up, then cry.

It's a McDonalds, the food is what it is. This particular McDonald's however, has awful, slow service to go along with their food. Drive through is incredibly slow, even when there are no other cars, and dine in is worse. Everyone is so focused on the slow drive through that they ignore you at the register. but I'm stupid enough to keep going back... so I'll give it a second star.

This location is decent. Food is okay. 

What earns the 1 star is the ridiculous payment hoops I have to jump through at night. I work nights and will stop here anywhere between 11pm and 1 am for dinner. Half the time the credit machine is down and they're only taking cash. The other half of the time they are counting drawers and it's card only. It's a different time every night. It's ridiculous. 

In-N-Out is 30 feet away and they take both forms of payment all night. Ridiculous that you turn away paying customers. The managers are ALWAYS rude and sassy about it.

Do not go to this Panera Bread, the service is absolutely ridiculous. Every single time I go there my order is messed up. Today they gave me two different sandwiches and still did not get it correct. Don't waste your money and save yourself a headache, they should be out of business. The last time my order was messed up I called and was lied to by an employee who told me they were a manager. He then continued to call me vulgar names, the GM didn't seem to care about this.

Food is mediocre compared to other Paneras I've been to. First floor internet is not dependable at all. 2nd floor is good. Service could be a lot better, but overall store is clean, organized, and beautiful.

I have been back here more than once after my disappointing first visit. It actually isn't that bad. Service could be a little bit better but the kitchen does a solid job and the food is alright. The restaurant has always been clean with a steady amount of customers.

The service sucked, when I went in the place was empty however they took FOEVER my food to be done. The forgot my bagel and didn't have any baguettes left. I noticed many people come back in and say something was wrong with their food or they were missing something. When I called to let them know about my missing bagel and demand store credit, I waited for 10 minutes and no one picked up. I'm so done with Panera's bullshit No wonder why they are getting bought out for 7 billion dollars, their employees don't even care anymore. If I could give them a zero I would. DO NOT GO THERE !!!

The cashiers seem like you're inconveniencing them, the counters were dirty and many tables had crumbs and was not clean.  The bathroom had no soap. And they ran out of milk, half n half, and had only slim milk for coffee at noon on a Saturday. The dispenser was sticky and nobody seemed to care.  Please panera, come fix this place. The wifi doesn't work. Mgt needs to evaluate how badly managed this place us
Panera is great! Asiago steak sandwich was a great dinner! You can swap a side of chips for a baguette. Yum! The baguette I got was warm!

I love Panera, and now one has finally opened near Case Western Reserve University. This location just opened, and the staff seems friendly so far. Its clean on the inside, and there is seating on the main floor, as well as the upper floor. I usually do the Pick-2 option, I love getting soup in the bread bowl, the bowl itself is delicious.

It smells like hot garbage on the second floor in its entirety and is so warm it's uncomfortable to sit there. Their wifi does not work and the management and staff is so slow and unhelpful. Last time I was there I was in a rush and didn't notice they forgot my soup in the bag and called afterwards to which I was treated so terribly and was yelled at for wanting the money back for the soup I never got. The manager also refused to help me with the issue unless I came back in that day which I was unable to do so I never got my money back for a $6 CUP of soup. Will never go back again.

Not sure why this Panera has bad ratings because the customer service and food quality were both up to Panera standard! Everything was made right away even with the customizations that I requested. It was not too busy during lunch time on a weekday with plenty of seating available. I will come back here when I am craving hot soup and sandwiches!
Got everything we needed at this Panera. Staff just wasn't so friendly. Like that they have an upstairs also.

Manager is completely RUDE to his employees. She asked for help with our Cinnabon order and he yelled from the back for who .. you? Then I said loudly "No, me!" Then he came out. She repeated our order twice before she went to the back and he still got it wrong. Then was annoyed when he had to redo it. She was in the back getting food ready for guests that were sitting down and he kept yelling her name and rolling his eyes. When we told him we were there last night but no lights were on so we thought they were closed even though it said open until 9 he said he was the new GM and that was not what he wanted to hear. I can't help thinking that the way he treats his employees they will be looking for a new GM shortly.
The Original on Sourdough is still one of the best sandwiches. Service here was very good. Clean restrooms and friendly staff. A little hard to get too if you don't know the area.

I went to the location off of the I17 and Dunlap in Phoenix. I had ordered an original sandwich because I received a promo code for a buy one get one free. Since I was at work I went ahead and ordered online for my convenience and I put the promo code in the instructions. All of the employees gathered around and we're being very rude saying they weren't going to honor the promo code because they didn't enter it when they saw the order. They were rude and unhelpful including the managers there. It was very unprofessional and embarrassing. They offered me no type of customer service. Keep in mind I am a regular and go very often since I work right up the street. I feel disrespected and at this point all I want is my money back. Oh and one more thing, they put sauce in the sandwich that i had specifically said not to on the instructions as I am allergic. This environment is ridiculous and not to mention the guy infront of me was being treated poorly as well. The corporate office needs to work on their customer service at I17 & dunlap. Never going back again.

I definitely WOULD NOT recommend this Cinnabon. Every time I go to a Cinnabon their rolls are fresh and not dry. They have always had a good reputation to me. 

This location, however, have given me multiple rolls that are dry every single time I've gone. They claim they are freshly made but what I receive tells a completely different story. I suggest either going to the one in Metro mall for the closest location or the one on 1401 Southern Ave. It's far but it's worth the drive. Just saving you money and dissatisfaction.
Amazing food and service I had the Tuscan on cibata sandwich and the Margarita flat bread they were so good I would and will recommend them to anyone

The food was cold at best and when I asked them to remake my food it took 45 minutes and then they ran out of what I originally ordered. The sandwich would have been small for the price, if it was consumable. Not impressed. Wish I could give 0 stars. 

Also, they forgot my pickle.
I ate the vegetarian sandwich here. It was fairly good. I still prefer the subways but it is good to eat once in a while. Its got that taste of a family owned restaurant.

One of the best Hot Sandwiches ever. 
Love their bread!!!!!  The best!!!
The type of food that you have to have more no matter how full you are.
I order a classic Cinnamon roll and it wasn't fresh. It tasted stale and crunchy... very unsatisfied! My first and last time at Schlotzsky's!
you know, for the location... it was pretty nice. the service was nice and the food what i normally would have gotten and tasted right. the restroom was nice and clean too.

I visit here a few times a month for lunch.  They are always very nice and quick.  Seriously speed WITH Service.  I normally get the General Tso Chicken with White Rice, Wonton Soup and Spring Rolls.  I love the crunchy taste of the chicken and the portions are just right.  Prices are great for lunch for this.  The exception is the sushi I haven't personally tried the sushi but several other friends have and told me not to even bother with it.  I thought the prices were a bit too high for my liking with regards to sushi.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is nice and they have very nice employees.  They accept contactless payments at this location which means full support for Apple Pay, Android Pay, Samsung Pay, Microsoft Pay, Visa PayWave, MasterCard PayPass.  The also are equipped for EMV which means your payment is safer.  I will continue to visit the location because it's so convenient to my work.  Fortune cookies too.
The ambience and place looks good. Lunch specials are worthy to try on week days. The sushi specials are simply awesome
Excellent food and service. Lunch  menu is loaded with great deals. I like the wonton soup, honey shrimp, and  pineapple cashews eggs chicken fried rice

Love this place! The wait staff are very friendly and attentive. The sushi is excellent! Can't go wrong with the BOGO sushi deal! And the cocktails are strong and delicious! The prices are also right on target.
Excellent food and service. This is one of the best Chinese restaurants in Charlotte! Unlike some Chinese restaurants they make their own sauces which is important to me because of the MSG.

April is Autism Awareness month. I would like to share a story about our family but mostly our wild and wonderful son. 

Wild East Pan Asian is our "safe" restaurant. Our 11 year old son is on the autism spectrum. We go there every Sunday for lunch. We feel welcome and at home the moment we walk in. The owner greets us by name, the sushi chefs wave and our favorite waitress starts Shane's order of two California rolls, miso soup (with a side of ice cubes to cool it), a spring roll and a special orange drink that only he can open. They even gave him a wrapped Christmas gift last year.

If Shane has a meltdown, they give him space and don't get offended if he does something others may deem inappropriate.

Every dish we've ever had there is superb. The sushi is the freshest in town. The chefs are incredibly creative and have created some fabulous rolls and Asian fusion dishes. 

Not all businesses and restaurants are friendly, accepting and welcoming to families with children on the spectrum. It's an incredible experience when we find one that is willing to get to know Shane for all of his shine and awesomeness and look past some of the behaviors that may occur.  Thanks to the entire staff at Wild East. Your kindness and generosity means more than you'll ever know to our family and others like us. 

https://www.autismspeaks.org/blog/2016/03/04/waitress-who-goes-above-and-beyond-my-son-autism

We just had a great dinner here. Prompt service and great food. Prices were reasonable given the quality of the meal. We will certainly be back! The Honey Walnut Shrimp and Spicy Thai Shrimp were excellent. The sushi roll was tasty and of more than adequate proportion.
Very good sushi. I usually get Chirashi plate, since you kind of getting sashimi and rice. But a little pricy!

I ordered Take-Out.  I got the Masaman Curry with Tofu & Vegetables.. it was okay.  Not very note-worthy, but not horrible.  I wish I had gotten it for lunch, it would have been cheaper and would have come with more stuff.  I would return for lunch in or take-out to give them another try.

Stopped in for a quick takeout lunch today and was very impressed. The menu offers, typical Chinese options, plus sushi, curry and some Thai! The lunch specials are very affordable for the portion!

I went with beef broccoli, which came with choice of soup and rice...all for $6! The container was even high class and not your typical Chinese containers. I also got the veggie egg roll app for $3 which came with two rolls. I'll be a regular in no time!

This Walgreens barely gets one star. It is consistently the worst pharmacy and this is the last time I will come here. The technicians are inept and rarely does a simple transaction go smooth. They can never find my prescription even after they've texted that it's ready! I would not recommend this store under any circumstances.

I've always had poor service at this pharmacy, long waits, unorganized, etc., but it's the closest pharmacy to our house so we continued to use it and sort of joke that it's got to be the world's worst pharmacy. Earlier today I went to drop off a Rx (to be filled today). I used the drive thru lane & waited for nearly 10 minutes for the pharmacy to service the customer ahead of me. When it was my turn, I handed the tech my Rx. She asked "do you need this filled today?" I responded with a yes... to which she said "actually, we are really busy today it will take 4-5 hours." So I asked for it back and told her I'll take it somewhere else. And that's what I plan to do for every Rx from now on. This Walgreen's location truly is the absolute worst.

WARNING!!!

Worst pharmacy ever.  A family member had surgery this AM and we left the RX for pain meds off on the way home.  I was told they needed an hour or an hour and a half to fill the prescription.  I phoned over two hours later
and still not ready.  I was connected to the call center and was disconnected.  I called back and left on hold.  What a circus!!   Spoke with two people who couldn't work their phone system to help me!

Hours later, still no prescription.  SHAME ON YOU, WALGREENS!

As close as this Walgreens is to our house, I rarely come here.  Don't ask my why, it's just never on my radar.  It's a standard Walgreens and offers the same layout and products that others have.  My most recent visit was just after Easter.  We dropped by here on the way home from Church to pick up some Easter Candies that were on sale.  I love the after-holiday sales where you can pick up stuff at big discounts.

I'll have to drop by more often.

Return Factor - 60%

Pharmacy has the worst customer service & takes forever to do anything! Every time I went to pick up medication, I would wait behind 1 or 2 cars for 20-30 minutes, it's insane! The Walgreen's itself is great but the pharmacy needs some help & to work more efficiently.

Just go to Walgreens for deals. Pharmacy is o.k. - could be better, especially when your husband has diabetes and you NEED supplies. Front cashier, older lady, was AWFUL! You leave the store in a good mood but in order to check out you HAD to hear about how awful EVERY customer that has walked in that store was that day.

I go to Walgreens only for one or two things since its so close, otherwise I would go to CVS if it was closer.

great products..unfortunate ;living on their rep rather than providing outstanding customer service.

always short staffed in pharmacy

What an absolute nightmare. I'm finally writing this review as this is my final straw. If anyone from corporate read this, please go in and start coaching these employees. I'm glad Walgreens provides employment and is a big corporation to do so, but I'm fed up with the run around. 

First off, the store is always in a cluster and never looks clean at all. No one smiles at you or greets you when you come in. Don't just stare at me wth!!!! Ask if I need any help or something, not walk or stand around with your finger in your ass. The pharmacy is an absolute disaster. They are just order takers. I get it a lot of people in this country are on pills/meds because that's where all the money is. So they are always busy getting stuff wrong and if you want over the counter they tell you what aisle it's on and point you on your way. 

I called today and talked directly to the pharmacy and asked If they had Tamiflu which I had a prescription for. I am sick and in desperate need to get better so I can work, not visit Walgreens. I made a SPECIAL trip and go out of my way. When I say I need this filled they say we are out. WTF do you mean you are out, I just called 10 min ago and you said you had it. Well they didn't. It was a halfass apology and the kid behind the pharmacy county could give two sh*ts about anything. Order taking. 

No wonder other reviews are the same. Garbage ratings fitted for this garbage service and establishment. I'm going to make a special trip miles out of the way to go to CVS or somewhere else.

Laura really is a piece of work. Walked up to me at the unattended photo desk and asked if I needed help, so I said I'm just waiting for the photo guy to come here because I was curious as to how long it would take for my photos to print with nobody in front of me. She goes, "Well that's not my area so I don't know how you want me to help you, I work up front. That's why we tell you to wait a day before coming back." Despite this being a one hour photo kiosk, I let it go. Not only that, SHE approached ME, not vice versa. When I go to check out with the couple other things I needed to pick up, she told me to come back and buy them tomorrow when I got my photos. ???? I said no, I'm here now because I need these items now. Then Laura proceeds to THROW AWAY MY COUPONS while looking me dead in the eye. If by any chance someone from HR is reading this, these employees need to go because quite frankly it isn't just Laura.

You might wonder why I'm writing a review on Walgreens. After all, they're pretty standard- most everyone's been and not much ever changes. But aside from the high prices (if you can help it, just go to Target people) Walgreens will surprise you with a new and interesting item every now and then. I went to get my disposable cam developed the other day and what did I find? Sitting there on the counter were a bunch of Venus Fly Trap plants. So cool. They're around $5.99 each, so I had to buy one. They lure little bugs into their 'mouths' and then snap shut to digest the bug. Personally I think it's really cool, but my friend thought I was insane for buying it. You be the judge. Go check them out!

I take a visit because the new restaurant opening my neighbor.
About 6 o'clock couple tables before me and I order some of the dishes Honey Shrimp it is a wonderful recipe I believe they use honey with big shrimp sooooo good, Mongolian beef taste so good almost like Korean Gogi, 
This new restaurant you must try yourself is so good and is a very nice cozy little Chinese restaurant I like the name MayFlower

Thanks for providing a welcoming and warm vibe. The ladies are pleasant and are very attentive. Best pork egg foo young for me,and happy family for my wife. And the crispy wonton chips are great. Great portions always.

Just finished our meal at the restaurant and it was great!!!!!   Food was exactly what we ordered, staff is very nice and personable, and always looking to please.  Definately keeping this on on the list for Chinese cuisine.

I'm so happy that there is now a fantastic Chinese restaurant in my neighborhood!  Mayflower has the most delicious Chinese food I've ever tasted, and I've eaten a lot of it.  I have no idea how they get their chicken so tender in their Curry Chicken, but it's silky and just melts in your mouth.  King Pao Shrimp is the dish I use as a benchmark for all Chinese restaurants and theirs is unmatched as far as I'm concerned.  I will be a loyal patron for many years, for sure!

2.0 star rating 6/21/2019
First to Review
A small restaurant just behind IHOP, Alma School/Elliot in the Fry's complex, open from 11AM to 9PM seven days a week.  They opened one week ago they said.  A small place with 10 booths and 6 tables of 4 seats. 
Reasonable lunch menu from 11 to 3 for $6.50 to $7.00.  They have a Happy Kid's Meal for $5.85 consisting of 3 choices from a 6 item menu: 7 Chicken Nuggets, 2 Chicken Wings, 2 Crab Rangoon, French Fries, 2 Chicken on a Stick, and Fried or White Rice. They serve 17 spicy dishes for those who like the heat.  They also serve wine and beer!  
Last night we had take-out from them.  I met the owner who smiled and shook my hand but did not speak English yet.  The young lady cashier and another older woman from the kitchen translated for her.  She wanted to give me a free 64 oz. bottle of Pepsi but I told her we do not drink any sodas at home and thanked her for the thought.  I ordered Pork Egg Foo Young, and upon eating it at home tried to give it some flavor with salt and pepper and soy sauce but it remained rather tasteless and we ate about half of it.  Our dog liked it however.  Also ordered General Tso's Chicken.  I asked if it was white meat and she spoke with the man doing the cooking and told me no, but if I wanted it with breast meat they could accommodate me.  I asked if they could make it extra spicy and she replied "it is already spicy".  I told her I like spice and to make it more spicy.  You guessed it!  It was almost without spice.  The photo on the back of their menu showed the chicken in the center of a ring of broccoli, but what I received was no broccoli but a few pieces of white onion and red peppers.  Once again the tasteless issue reared it's head.  Hardly any flavor, little to no hot spicy taste and the pieces of chicken were cut small, and were tough and chewy, but abundant.  We ate less than half of this dish, which salt and black pepper and soy sauce could not redeem it.
I hated to give them a low rating but the food was 2 star and an extra 1/2 star for the friendly service.

Doug T. voted for this review

 Useful 1   Funny 1   Cool 1

Support this great restaurant in Chandler! We live in the neighborhood and decided to give it a go for lunch today. We were not disappointed! 

The decor inside was beautiful and clean. It was apparent that a lot of hard work went into the birth of this establishment. Our meal started with wonton chips. Who doesn't love wonton chips? We ordered off of the lunch combinations menu which is so affordable and generous in size. The combos are complete with choice of soup, as well as your main dish, rice, a spring roll, and crab rangoon. I went with their Happy Family dish...you've gotta give it a go when you're here! Hands down, I'll be ordering it again. My husband got the shrimp and lobster sauce which he also enjoyed.

This restaurant was also loved by our children. We have a 6 year old that tried and loved everything we ordered. Our 3 year old had his favorite, chicken nuggets which we were thankful they had available for him! In the end, we fed 4 bellies for less than $25. 

If you are ever in the area, support this small business. The employees were so friendly and treated us so well. 
By far, better than other Chinese restaurants in their league!

Tried this place after several recommendations. 1st visit we had chicken chowmein, pork fried rice, potstickers & egg drop soup, fried wonton chips were very stale. Good portion sizes but food was extremely greasy, egg drop soup was very bland.  2nd Chance visit, went to lunch, great lunch special -$6.25 soup,egg roll, entree choice, fried rice. Fried wontons were very stale Again, food was very greasy Again to where the portion we ate there was a puddle of grease on the plate! Although I tried the Pork egg foo young & it was DELICIOUS, it reminded me of the ones I use to have at my favorite restaurant that closed down 4 years ago, maybe even better! this would be the ONLY thing I return to this restaurant for. Staff was friendly & attentive.

My family went to dinner here tonight and it was really good! Patrick was very friendly and made sure that we were enjoying our food; we ordered happy family (my son loved the shrimp), orange chicken and fried rice - it was all hot and fresh! Thank you for a delicious meal

The food is delicious, big portions and low price.  The place is clean and all staff are so friendly.  I like everything that I order.  The kung Po chicken, Mongolian beef, hot and sour soup, kids meals, etc.  All fresh made.  Even the rice, is fresh and the texture just like the rice I cook at home.  Definitely will come back and recommend this place to my friends and family.

Lovely restaurant tucked in the southeast corner of Alma School and Elliot! Great service with amazing food! Bring your appetite! Their lunch specials are served daily until 3pm and it's enough food for 2 meals! We will definitely be back to try more items on the menu!

I walked into Arnold's today for the first time during my work lunch break. I was immediately taken wth the rustic decor and comfortable seating. The space is divided in two (without feeling separate). One side is the cafe where you order teas, lunch, small bites, etc. This side also has tables for dining. The other side boasts a comfy sofa with side chairs and tables. 
The tea selection is immense without being overwhelming. I absolutely love the ginger twisted tea (iced) and the BLT was yummy too. 
If you're a tea snob or casual tea drinker, this place serves your needs.

I'm so glad I finally got to stop in here! Every time I ride my bike I always thinking about stopping. The other day my fiancé and I stopped in to grab a coffee and tea. 

She got the lavender lemonade tea. It was a little bitter but the barista sweetened it a bit which made it better. I would definitely order it again. 

I got the coffee latte with milk. It was more just coffee and milk than a latte. There was no foam in the drink at all. Either way the coffee had good flavor. 

The mood is very welcoming inside to anyone! There were kids with their parents, people working on laptops and couples talking around the corner. There is a big couch to lounge on and an electronic fireplace to make the room even more cozy! 

I am excited to visit in the future again to try more items on the menu. If you live in North Side this is a must go to place!
Unbelievably delicious Turkey sandwich.  Great service. Love this place. James and all the staff were so nice!!

Delightfully helpful staff, but NOT a tea shop. More like a sandwich shop that serves some tea. People who love tea will know what I mean. 

Atmosphere is not cozy come sip sit and relax, more like get some lunch with tea, on your quick one hour break from work.

Prices are good and they do have a selection of loose tea as well as by the cup. I thought the selection pretty standard (hibiscus, Earl grey, golden monkey, gunpowder) but seriously lacking for a place calling itself a tea shop. (Only a single Pu-erh and it was not pure but mixed with chocolate orange) 

Meh.

This is the cutest cosiest tea shop! They have a great variety of drinks. I got a basil lavender lemonade, the "lavenade" and it was so good! They also serve a nice selection of salads, sandwiches, and baked goods. I had the happy turkey club and it was delicious! This is a must-do in Pittsburgh!

*need to update 
Lunchtime 
35 min I asked if they forgot about me no I was assured my sandwich was being made next ...still 
Waiting 45 min for a sandwich 
What's up with that? Line of about 10 people when I walked in
Kitchen seems staffed with 5 people 
My iced tea was delish as always but it took 15 min
My lunch hour totally down the drain
No apology

Was walking down the street one day and stumbled upon Arnold's, all I can say is that I am glad.  The first thing I noticed was the space and the decor, both pleasing. I have enjoyed many teas and sandwiches since then, and hope the Arnold's continues to expand on the menu.
Very cool atmosphere, rustic and homey. Larger than I expected on the inside with a side room that has a large couch and tables to work at. Tea is delicious and the staff are friendly.
So glad we found this place. Worked from here for two days straight eating breakfast, lunch, and lots of tea. Great spaces, nice staff, and amazing tea selection.

This is a wonderful addition to East Ohio Street! Very comfortable and stylish furniture, fantastic  selection of teas. The sandwiches look good and taste great. We sprawled in the sunny window seat with pots of Blood Orange tea and delicious coffee cakes. We stayed longer than planned because the space is so inviting and the service is so friendly and accomodating. Could be New York or Chicago but no, it's the NorthSide!
Now we have a place to hang-out.

I'm a super Jamba fan I come into this Jamba a few times a week and this was the first time I was upset with my jamba. We ordered two large drinks the razzmatazz and the surf rider both were incorrect and they replaced mine with a smaller drink they were completely understaffed or under trained either way I'll be avoiding Jamba for now!!!
I love my Aloha Pineapple, but I hate bananas! Every JJ I've visited is happy to substitute the bananas for more strawberries - yum! This location is clean and the staff is friendly.

Great customer service. Employee was very knowledgeable of the ingredients and the effects on the human body; very useful information. Too pricey for an every day drink but nice as a weekly treat. Wish there was more 'juicing' menu items/suggestions with veggies.
My girls love this place, my debit card does not. :-( it's great and delicious but expensive for what you get! Happy juicing!!

I like this location. The girls are always super friendly and I have never had an issue with my smoothies! I like the upbeet & apples and greens smoothie.  I think the prices are bit high for what you get but that would be my only complaint!

FYI: Google/Yelp renders the location incorrectly, it's actually about a mile south of where it appears making this a difficult location to check-in at. It's in the shopping center just south of the 202 next to Ono's Hawaiian BBQ. Bing maps this address correctly, Google will if you change the Address to Gilbert 85236.

As I have stated in previous reviews, I don't give out 1 stars unless I see animals in an establishment because I know the people are trying.  However, that being said this morning we went was rough for some of the employees as they made some mistakes and their was a customer being difficult.  It seemed to be a whirlwind of chaos, which I felt bad for the employees, but that being said if I compare it to other JJ's I've been to, this one is at the bottom of the list due to the atmosphere.  Hopefully it gets better and the vibe is a lot more positive, if I end up back I will update if this location improves

Of all of the chain smoothie shops, we like this one the least. At this location, the service is hit or miss, slow and the smoothies overpriced with ice chunks. The only positives are a few of the flavors and the option of a smaller smoothie side with the ability to "make it light."

Every time I come here, I get the banana berry. Note its not on the menu, however just tell them the name and they'll ring it right up! I like coming here because the drinks are refreshing and real. By real, I mean the ingredients are fresh and you can actually taste the natural sweetness of the fruits. Oppose to the other smoothie places I've been to, they are often watery/icee or too sweet with some type of syrup. Blah! Not my kind of smoothie. Jamba Juice is the place to go to get your fix. 
Cons, it may be a little bit expensive to make a daily habit. Other than that, very clean and friendly. I'll always come back!

I arrived here at 8:50 and the lights are off and no employees are even inside. They are supposed to close at 9:00 so I know I was cutting it close but it appears that the employees closed early and went home. That's just ridiculous. Don't bother coming to this location.
We had a lovely dinner. The salad bar was absolutely delicious. Great service and all their meats were fabulous

Good service, friendly staff. Great selections at salad bar (not just salad) and skewered meats running around the place. It is as good as Fogo and a little less money. We would go again, if occassion arises.

One the best food experiences of my life. I've been to several Brazilian steakhouses and this was the best experience. Salad bar wasn't just a bunch of fillers to keep you from the cuts of meat but really good food that's worth the money. The meat was superb. Yelp wants me to write more but Yelp is a 1 star app but this restaurant is 5 star.

Wow...first you need to be hungry because it's a ton of food! Second...you must love meat because this is definitely a meat eating place. Every single meat we tried was tender, flavorful and cooked to perfection. 

Their salad and hot side bar is insane with the number of options! The lobster bisque was smooth and flavorful and had lots of small chunks of lobster. Sitting next to it was a bowl of seasoned yucca and we sprinkled some on the bisque. It added a unique flavor and just amplified the creamy bisque. 

We indulged with dessert and had the crepes which were decadent with orange cream and marmalade. My wife loved it but she loves anything orange...for me it was ok. Served with rich vanilla ice cream which was yummy!

And a shout out to Dylan! He was personable and efficient and made our visit great!

1st time at a Brazilian steakhouse and it did not disappoint. Full assortment of cold items to chose from for starters. The marinated mushrooms were the best I'd ever had. The Brazilian potatoes salad was a nice crunch surprise.
I didn't touch the hot dishes wanted to save room for the meat but it all looked good.
The meat was tender, full of garlic  and so yummy. Loved every thing I tried except the pork in parmesan was dry. But it was very late at night so I'm not complaining. The bacon wrapped chicken with something I've never tried before almost like a chicken sandwich full of spice. The filet mignon was melt-in-your-mouth. I could have just eaten that but there was too many other things to try. Definitely a place to come back to for a special evening or if you're just craving ALOT of good meat.

AMAZING 
Fantastic 
This place just opened 
Great Service 
The Food Was Very Fresh
Classy environment 
Very Attentive Servers
Answering any Questions 
I myself I'm not a big meat eater
The salad bar was plenty by itself. I also do gluten-free 
For someone who is gluten-free this is a amazing place to dine.
I will definitely let Friends and Family know 
About this Restaurant.

I've been to several Brazilian steakhouses, and this is now my favorite!  Clean, fresh and expertly trained staff.  

Their salad buffet is amazing!  Fresh veggies, charcuterie, salads, soup, fish, rice and beans.  Available alone, or included with the full experience. 

There is an extensive wine selection and a beautiful glass walled wine cellar. There's a full bar available as well.  

My husband was a huge fan of the traditional cheese buns, fried polenta and bananas.  

The traditional parade of meats on skewers begins, and the team is ready to accommodate special requests! They have a great dessert menu, but was too full to partake!  

We look forward to returning.
We dine in here for my birthday celebration. The food is great. Server is nice. We will definitely come back again.

The buffet selections are plentiful and delicious. There were multiple selections of exceptionally tasty meat.

Kymberly and Shelly were very personable and fun. The total experience was awesome. When in town we shall definitely return.

Galeto was pretty good. Not my favorite Brazilian Steakhouse but it was good. For the prices, it is not as fancy as others so I would expect a little less price for what you get here personally(Or kick it up a few notches). Again, overall, it was good. The salad bar has many many items but be sure not to fill up and wait for the meats. I felt the salad bar was set up and left as is, like the items were not being checked on or replenished. For example, the spinach and lettuce were wilted and the caprese salad didn't look very fresh.. can you imagine the seafood? Anyway, I loved the wide variety of wines Galeto had and the service was very Nice. Obviously my favorite was the tomahawk ribeye but I also enjoyed the ahi tuna, lobster bisque and salmon. I'll visit again if I'm ever in the area with a strong appetite. By the way-- it would be cool if all the gauchos were wearing the pants! Only one was.
Best grilled wings!!!  I love the pet friendly patio and being able to chill with my pooch while watching football.

Ok guys.. so everyone claims they have the best wings blah,blah,blah!!!!! wait these guys really do have great wings!!! Whoop, whoop!!! It's about time I find good wings nice and crispy with good flavor and not full of grease they toss them on the grill so you have that little extra char flavor..
We had the Ko wings they came with lime slices I kind of thought what the heck but tried it wow very good...

They have a nice patio with misters its dog friendly.. 
They have  24 tv screens holly guacamole and that's only on the patio. They also have off track vetting here.
Much better than average sports bar food. Breads are amazing. We were very pleasantly surprised at the overall food quality.
Great time at K O'Donnell's with the team. Food was excellent and service was fast - Chris was the best!

1 star- why? The food wasn't too bad. My husband had the fish tacos which were good. I ordered the Sicilian Stuffed Chicken, but get this... it's not even stuffed. I had food envy.

Anyway, the waitress was super busy and I had to wave her down everytime I needed something. We went there tonight after Costco. Kid's eat free on Sundays. I've never even been there, so I didn't know. The waitress "forgot" to take the kid's meals off. It's advertised on the colorable menus. Then when I gave her my Groupon, she said she couldn't accept it. Now mind you, we ordered a couple of rounds of alcoholic drinks, so our bill wasn't low. And no where on the Groupon did it say that it couldn't be used with a special. A Groupon would normally state that.

After I am "allowed" to use my Groupon, I won't go back there again. We go out several times a week out to eat, and I'd rather spend my money somewhere else. The food was decent, but I definitely wouldn't rave about it. The waitress took almost 20 minutes to get our bill situated. My husband was annoyed that we were waiting for so long. The owner, who was very nice, had to close out our check and bring us a box. We never even saw the waitress again. Way to go!

Oh, and it was the same temperature inside as it was outside. I guess they're really doing that bad and can't turn on the air conditioner. My 2 year old was sweating for the first time.

Totally transformed.... must check out. Food went from all fried crap bar food to fresh fish, salads, meats. 
U guys been there before? U won't recognize it. 
Just finished patio... so many TVs. Very nice & modern now. Great HH Specials & Drinks.. kept prices low. 
Great Service
Great job KO's!

If you want a sit-down restaurant for a quick lunch, this is a good place to head. They have some nice (and different) sandwich and salad options including a turkey and brie sandwich and a "biltmore" salad with blue cheese, corn, and baked chicken. 

My biggest gripe is that they keep changing suppliers for their food! My husband and I tend to head here before the movies maybe about once a month. They seem to really have the food down...and then they change it up (have seen this on everything from fries to tortilla chips.) 

Also, if you are looking for a quiet lunch, don't go during a sports game! This place gets pretty noisy with the 20+ TVs going and the fans cheering.

Had one of the best breakfast burritos ever!!! Green chile pork and scrambled eggs that was huge!! The bartender (Laura) was extremely friendly and made some kick-ass drinks. All of the bartenders and servers were extremely friendly and the place had every college game on! I'll be back!

There are so many good things about KO's ... I don't know where to start!  First, the food is excellent and reasonably priced.  The service is great, too! When I go in, I feel like the waitresses and bartenders have been my friend for ages.  Robbie is my go-to bartender, and recently was served by a girl Angela who was so great!  A couple reviews down someone talked about getting bad service and I feel like they have no idea what they are talking about.  I've had bad service before, but never EVER at KO's!
The grilled wings and jambalaya were fantastic. Tvs all over for a variety of sports. Great service!

We tried this Culver's on Friday 4-14-17. It was our first time at a Culver's and we loved it. A big thank you to Jaci, who helped us and made a great first impression. She answered our questions while being very pleasant and friendly, smiling the whole time. She had energy and is what customer service is all about! This Culver's was close to our hotel, so we tried it and enjoyed the experience so much we went back the next day, and would have returned the following day as well, but it was closed for Easter. My wife had a salad and said it was perfect, while I enjoyed the cod fish and chips. The fish was plentiful, with big portions prepared just right, and came with crinkle cut fries (my favorite), and the cole slaw was perfect. The Culver's root beer is right up there with Barq's and A&W. The next day we had the pot roast dinner - delicious, thought I was at my Mom's house! We also enjoyed the frozen custard which tasted better than ice cream. Culver's is our new go-to restaurant the next time we're in town!

I was not impressed with their deluxe cheeseburger. There was just not much flavor, and even adding salt and mustard did not help. The bun stuck to the box on both my wife's, and my burger. This made it very messy to eat.

This is my second visit in two years and while I think the food is pretty good there are other places I would choose to go first. 

I went with the traditional butter burger, cheese curds and a chocolate Reece's peanut butter cup concrete mixer. 

The burger was pretty good. I really liked the bun. I also went with the cheese curds which is a nice change up from the normal fries. 

The mixer was ok but not so good that I would go out of my way to have it again. My husband had root beer and it was really good.  

The staff is super friendly and everything is really clean.

Pleasantly surprised when I took a shot in the dark by asking if they serve a veggie burger patty. I didn't notice it on the menu. They came through and all the fixings (pickle, onion, tomato, lettuce, and mayo) are standard. Put together a meal with fries and a drink under $8. Will go again next time scheduling calls for last minute drive thru.

Culver's is probably the best tasting fast food places there is- however this particular location is not too great when it comes to the customer experience. I've been here a handful of times and the staff is super grumpy and there is always some sort of issue with my order. But still worth the cheese curds
This was my first time trying Culvers and i loved it. The food is fresh and the restaurant is clean. The staff is very friendly and on top if everything as well. I would return :)

I LOVE Culvers food.... However, at this location I had a discrepency with my coupon and the owner Gary Landreth was absolutely rude to me and would not honor the coupon. I will never return to this location. He needs to learn what customer service is if he expects to keep customers long term... He said horrible and judgemental things to me and about me. I will never return.

My taste buds were out of service when I came here. I had minimal taste but I could tell that what I was eating was delicious. The patty on the burger looked good. The fries not so much but the cheese curds were good. I wanted to taste it so bad I went back two days later and I wasn't disappointed. Everything was good. Their ice creams were good too. I wish we had Culver's in California.

Went out for a quick late night dinner before heading back home today.  Grabbed a butter burger with cheese and a cold pack of rocky road ice cream.  Place was spotless, food was fantastic and the ice cream incredible!  Perfect ending to a great vacation.  Staff was very swift and friendly.  Two thumbs up

I will say this, had they been kinder towards me when I was ordering I would of rated them higher. 
I took my daughter and two young boys through the drive thru to get ice cream  but my boys 5&6 decided they wanted a kids meal burger. First time here I asked her and let her know "Hey First time here!" Her response, well let me know when your ready?  Of course I have questions. Besides the bad attitude we ordered 2 kid burger meals 3 Oreo shakes and 1 vanilla cone.

I've been coming here for about 10 years and while I understand price increases, at these prices at least serve Pepsi or Coke products, and not under the guise of a "free drink". It's normal for a drink to be included in a combo. The food is still good, Joe's sauce is still great. Just seems to be missing the pizzazz of the good ole days of like 2008-2009 with what feels like penny pinching.

Service is another story, basically non existent and they should review their hiring practices.

Thin crust pizza should not be limp, which ours was.  The toppings were sparse.  We ordered a 16" sausage pizza which didn't even have two sausages per slice.  We also ordered a Popeye which did have good flavor (the reason for the stars) but again, crust was so soggy and limp it was not enjoyable.  Certainly not worth the prices they charge.  Very disappointed.

I've been going to this place over 10 years! By far my absolute favorite place to eat. Their pizza is amazing! Not to mention their ranch and "Joe's Sauce"! The staff is always super friendly and helpful! I can't believe it's gotten such low reviews. And disgusts me people would compare this to franchises and chains :(  Please support this local business, it'll be well worth it! 

Favorite slice is the bbq chicken, and I recommend ordering in for lunch!

We Called this location in chandler and was prepared to make a VERY large order for myself and my fellow employees. Yet when we called we were met with an atrocious attitude and disgusting domineer from a Jimmy & Joe's pizzeria named Sally. We asked for clarification on some deals and asked for the manager. She continuously interrupted us on the phone and declared she was the manager. I really hope the real manager Amy of Jimmy & Joe's can get ahold of this store employee who gives her self promotions while simultaneously demoting her own company she works for, she single handedly ruined a $300.00 minimum order just went next door to the always fresh and kind Barros. Thank you sally for making she not only my self but my entire company will never darken J&J's ever again.

First things first, I hate Yelp. I'm literally only writing a review because the service at this pizza place was the WORST experience I've ever had. I've worked in restaurants, I know how it is and how frustrating it can be. All I got was a large pizza and some wings. Simple right? Na, we got our pizza with ricotta and it was the saltiest ricotta I've ever had. I doubt it's normally like that because it was so salty it burned your throat as you ate it. Only 2 slices were eaten and the rest were trash. The wings we asked for well done and it was like they dunked them in the fryer for a few seconds and put straight into the box along with all the oil from the fryer basket. No sauce, just squishy chicken covered in oil. I tried for 2 weeks to get ahold of a manager to no avail. Apparently the best time to call for a manager at a pizza place is in the morning between 8:30-9? Whatever, I ultimately gave up because I figured the $40 thrown in the trash wasn't worth the time and hassle trying to get a hold of the higher ups anymore. Like I said, I hate yelp. It took a lot of nerve for me to post this. When it comes to pizza, my standards are super low as I love all pizza. I'd rather eat a frozen totinos than spend money on this garbage . This is the last place I'd ever recommend to anyone.

I go here once or twice a week. It's quick for lunch and a great value. The staff is always super nice. The slices show up quick and for the price it can't really be beat. Is it the absolute best pizza I have had five stars on taste alone? No, but it's still very good and when you combine the price, the staff, and the speed this becomes a go to lunch spot. I can't speak to the menu beyond the pizza but my coworker I bring in really like the wings. They have salads but alas I am not a rabbit so I have never partaken.

SO SO SO SO YUMMY. 

It was 9:45 on a bright Saturday morning after ACS Making Strides walk around the Tempe Lake. I was famished! My buddy suggested this place and he was utterly confident that I won't be disappointed aaaand he was so right. We got there 15 minutes before opening and waited in their patio area. Both of us ordered the Serious Slice with just plain ol' cheese. Let me tell you, it was quite a serious slice alright. At 14", they gave us pizza cutters to slice it as a plastic knife wouldn't do the job well. It was fresh and the cheese was perfect. The price of the slice and everything else on the menu includes a drink. I will definitely be back when I'm craving pizza again.

Pie is okay. It's definitely over priced. The female who answered the phone did not say hello, or thank you. Was slightly awkward. She seemed very unpleasant. I'll be ordering from somewhere else next time.
Amazing service and the BEST pizza! This place is the real deal. I often have to make catering orders and Amy & terry are a treat to work with.

Quite possibly the worst Italian "food" I've ever had the misfortune to throw out half-eaten. The pizza was limp and soggy with a chewy "crust" that was more like Wonder bread than an actual pizza crust. It had an unwanted surprise aftertaste of hot chili flakes that left me angry nobody warned me about. And I could not find anything that resembled an actual meatball in their meatball sandwich. It appeared to have small dense cubes of something slightly resembling beef hidden in an overly tomato pasty sauce enfolded in a long limp bread roll. I had to toss it after a few bites. The store seemed to be run by a game bunch of teenagers giving it the feel of a frat house, and it reeked of stale vinegar. In three words...don't go there!

Pros:

-- Great place to meet people, both inside and outside the building where they have tables
-- Free wifi
-- Free parking in the bank lot on the side street and metered indoor parking across from the bank lot
-- Manager and some staff members are very friendly and professional
-- Frequent chess playing, especially in summer
-- Close to Jillian's bar if you need a beer break


Cons:

-- Due to the quantity of people who come through here, cleanliness is an issue at times
-- Some workers are not friendly and seem to have an attitude
-- One bathroom out of order frequently, one part of roof leaking at times, some wifi outlets cracked or not working

The staff that they have working here now in University Heights Ohio are is very shitty I've been coming here for two years and it's never been bad until now. I will definitely have to find another Starbucks to go to even though this one is more convenient I'll be have to be inconvenienced because I'm being inconvenienced either way I go. It's one thing when people know your drink and make it for you but now they just assume and get upset when you tell him that that's not what you want I've been ordering the same thing for a little over a year and now because is a different variation of it and most people get that variation they assume that I want it as well which they should not do and then they tell me that I need to be more specific when is not my job to be specific because that's what I've been doing and that's what the original drink is it's their job to make sure they get that shit right and they have not done that yet. There was a worker here named Evan I don't think he's there anymore but he was nice and that's about it.

Your generic Starbucks.

Had a latte here because it was the closest Starbucks to Case Western's campus.

It's a - ok.
The best Starbucks in the US!  Exceptional baristas who are friendly and speedy.  Great ambiance - not insanely noisy or blasting music like some places.  Thanks Cedar Fairmount team!

Pretty nice location with a garage in the back (25c per hour). Very spacious Starbucks with plentiful seating and lots of outlets - great for studying! They also have giant full-length windows facing Cedar so great for people watching too :)

Sat here for about an hour enjoying my coffee and saw lots of foot traffic come through here, but on a weekday morning, there were no more than 3-4 people in line at a time, and I received my drink within 5 minutes of ordering, so they seem to be well staffed. It was also really quiet compared to other Starbucks that I've been to, so again, probably a great study spot :)

I really love this location of Starbucks. The seats by the fireplace are so cozy for a browsing on your laptop or reading a newspaper. There are two long tables at the front, a few high top tables, and various tables scattered about that can sit 2 - 4 people. The employees here are always friendly and the service is quick in the afternoon and evening (I haven't visited during morning rush hour time so I can't speak for that). It can get packed in the evenings, especially when exams hit the CWRU undergrads, so just keep that in mind. 

I've never had a problem finding a seat near an outlet, if I needed it - some of the outlets on the floors didn't work for me, but I haven't tried since. 

Overall, this is a great location for a study spot or to catch up with a friend, especially since it is just down the street from some great restaurants.

I am not a fan of Starbucks coffee but this one is exceptional. The location is good, they do a lot of business and the staff is nice. I go in occasionally for the ice tea. They have nice outdoor seating. WiFi is pretty slow. Seating is really really hard to come by. With a bit of remodeling they could accommodate all of their guests.

Now who does not like Starbucks I love Starbucks they have different varieties of coffees drinks they have a new menu where all kinds of different healthy foods I highly recommend a must go,
also staff is friendly and make sure you tell them how you have a pacific thing you want in your coffee or whatever you like

Friendly service, space is large and airy.  Storefront faces south so huge windows in the landmark Tudorbethan Heights Fairmont building let in plenty of light.   Space could be a little less cluttery, but this is a quibble.  Location is convenient, in a beautiful area of town with plenty of character, and there is a parking garage in the rear.  Watch the world go by...

As solid a Starbucks as you can get. The baristas are always extremely friendly and get my order right and quickly. This is one of the few Starbucks that not only has extended hours compared to the coffee shops in the area but is open on select holidays. 

It is always clean (my standards for Starbucks have fallen a little since Starbucks bathrooms have become public bathrooms). There are different seating options from high tops to communal tables to two seaters to leather chairs. Good natural light throughout the store. Always a stocked display case/food supply. What can you complain about?
A solid store to get your caffeine fix or to do the Sunday NYT puzzle!

PS the bathrooms are a little hidden down a white hallway in the back, past the supply storage that looks like it leads elsewhere. :o)

AMAZING!!!!!!!!!  LOVED IT!  The turkey burger, west side style, was on point.  I got a side salad with it, citrus avocado, and felt amazing after I ate it...so fresh!  My husband tried the American burger with crisp veggies and surprisingly enjoyed it as well (I'm slowly converting him on to the eat healthy eat local craze...and I'm winning!!!).  We will be back in a few days again I'm sure, perfect for lunch or dinner.

Really like this place BUT pretty sure it will be out of business in 12-24 months. Not because of food quality but foot traffic is very poor. Each time we have been, there is hardly anyone there. Went there to grab a salad for dinner (take-out) and it was like they were closed; so dead inside. Agree that it's a little pricey but the salads are good!

First time here and it's was amazing. I'm allergic to gluten and while looking at multiple menus Sean came outside and greeted us and talked about the food. It's hard to find a place my boyfriend and I can both eat at due to my allergy. He was able to get a burger and I was able to get a bowl with quinoa. There chicken is actually real chicken. They were doing free sides and the grilled corn is a must. Sean even excluded the oil because of my allergy. He came buy and even explained the process that he took to make sure I was taken care of. Such passionate and knowledgeable staff.

Everything tastes really good. The smoothies,salads & flavored lemonade. 

I only gave 3 stars because it took incredibly long, both times, to get our food. So my wife ordered online and it was ready, but the portions weren't the same.
Probably one of my favorite places to eat. Fresh tasty food. Only thing I would change is that it was faster. But kinda hard to rush fresh made to order.
Harvest kale salad has been my fav salad so far. Four stars because their to-go portion is significantly much smaller than what you get if you dine in.

Went in on a late Saturday afternoon. Ordered the spicy avocado & lime super grain mix bowl and my fiancé ordered the veggie burger "west style side" with regular fries and we both got a mix of of the delicious lemonades that they had prepared. The food was absolutely delicious !!!! The cashier was very helpful in describing all of the differences between items on the menu. The restaurant was clean and the same server was cleaning tables so it was maintained. They also sell beer and wine which was a plus. Overall a really great place to have lunch or dinner.
***Update***
The manager Coral and the cashier Maria helped us out  the second time we visited( the next day). We will definitely be visiting again

You want tasty and healthy, this is your spot!  Had an awesome chicken salad at lunch time, service was great, salad DIVINE and just an all round cool place to hang out and chill at lunchtime.  Highly recommend a visit, you won't be disappointed.

I had an appointment over in Ballantyne but had a moment to get lunch. I went to B Good and wanted to get the spicy avocado chicken bowl with grains. I'm fairly indecisive when it comes to food sometimes but I knew I wanted that. I ordered but was told there weren't any grains until Wednesday. It was Monday. So I opted for the southwestern salad instead. It was good, fresh and I did like the freshly grilled chicken, corn nuts and dressings on the side. When I'm near there again, I'll try again. People around me seemed to enjoy the burgers and someone had ice cream.
B Good- nice restaurant. Staff is extremely friendly. You must try the lemonade. Jesus, it's so good. You must visit. It is in a nice area

I used Jim at Cranberry Creek for catering and it was AWESOME!!  Delivery: was on time and she set everything up.
Food was D-Lish:  Turkey / BBQ Chicken / Potato Salad / Chili was one of the best I've had / Carrot Cake was great!! 
Price: Very reasonable I felt for everything I got.  
I would highly recommend Cranberry Creek for catering in Madison area.

We happened upon the restaurant because it was off the highway with outdoor seating that allowed pets. Our orders include an A1 burger with fries, Fish and Chips, and a Reuben with fries. We also got an order of fried pickles. We all loved our food and were impressed with the portions as well as the quality. If I lived in the area I would return!

I like the casual ambience a lot. It's very cozy. I've had a few things, and the burger was my favorite. Tilapia dinner I do not recommend. Decent prices and Nice portions though. Business hours limited.

I've pasted this place everyday to work for over 2 months and finally being on my vacation I made it a note to stop. The simple menu gave me some comfort I found what I wanted with in seconds. I paid up front sat done and in about 15 minutes I had my food. 

The service was just what i wanted, close but knew when they were need. For the price I've never felt so full. Hidden back on Broadway is a treasure of a cafe.

My boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch a very days ago. We both had burgers with fries. Everything was very greasy and bland. And seemed overpriced for what we got. 

The staff was extremely friendly, but we will probably never go back.

We walked into Cranberry Creek for the first time for lunch, but it will not be our last.
From the unique front counter order taking style. 
To the beautiful fireplace, to enjoy a nice cup of Fair Trade coffee and scone by, this is not your ordinary restaurant. 
For us, we were on the hunt for burgers and found them. They had breakfast specials that looked amazing, but wanted what we wanted!
 Great hostess and waitress was attentive.
Have I gotten to the food? 
I did the Build your Own Burger, medium rare, adding Bacon, Blue Cheese and all the extras lettuce, onion, tomato,  and pickle. Also ordered onion ringers, which had a crispy coating like non I have tasted before. Originally I had ordered fried pickles, but changed to the onion rings, they brought those too at no charge since they made them by mistake! 
Love the extra love to the meal! Especially since initially they forgot my bacon, but the hostess made sure things were fixed! 
See we walked in strangers and left like family.  I felt so comfortable, I accidentally walked out with my water cup. Had to walk back in!
 Yes, thankfully I realized! 
Now I cannot wait to go back and try the fish fry!

We had Cranberry Creek Catering for our wedding this July and overall we were satisfied with everything.  Communication was very good, Jim was always quick to return calls and spend time answering questions for us.  The tasting at the cafe was delicious and was the main reason we picked Cranberry Creek for catering.  We chose the Pot Roast and the Cranberry Chicken and everyone was telling us how much they loved it.  They delivered to our reception about an hour away and provided everything including cutting our cake after we did the traditional thing for photos.  Just remember to tell them if you want someone to stay or serve at the event otherwise they'll setup everything then leave and return when you want them to.  The plates were nice, linens were clean, delivery was smooth, food was hot, tasty and plentiful and pickup was quick.  Delivery guy earned a nice tip for taking the time to congratulate us, ask us how the food was and offering to pack up the leftovers.

I took my family here for breakfast.  It's not too far from us and I had passed it several times thinking we should try it or.  It's a sit down restaurant that you place your order at the counter for, at least in the morning we did.  I did not mind this because we could walk in and place the order then go find our seat as opposed to waiting to have someone come and take our drink then our food order, time matters with 3 kids.  The food options were good, the prices were very responsible compared to others in the area that can break the bank.  They are a little secluded, the entrance is off a side road.
Great place for breakfast or lunch. Counter service is a plus for me. If you're one to have trouble deciding, the CC original burger might be the best burger in Madison. Love the truffle fries too!

My plate is almost cleaned off!!The food and atmosphere are always so good!! This is a weekend eatery for family or a great place to have lunch and talk business during the week!! We have never had a bad meal here in 4 years!! Great service and great food!!

I love bantha. I'm not a big tea drinker but these guys are super nice and care about the neighborhood. They created an eco business and care about the staff. They're god dudes. I'm happy they are neighbors and here. I don't go in as much as I should because I'm a coffee person but appreciate they will always make coffee and are offering more brunches and such too. Good dudes. Good place.
Cool little spot. Great vibe. Friendly folks running the place. Even though it's night time, I couldn't resist the black fennel chai. So good.
Cool place.. Laid back vibe with interesting teas.. The iced teas were great on the hot day we went there
Great service and a wonderful array of teas to choose from. I'll definitely return to Bantha Tea Bar for delicious caffeine and caffeine free teas. Wi-Fi is available to customers.

Bantha is a funky, cool neighborhood spot for tea, and if you're so inclined, snacks and coffee. I'll stop by occasionally with my wife to do some writing. There's a substantial amount of seating at the shop, and easy access to power outlets at tables along the wall, plus free Wi-Fi.

The selection of tea is staggering. I'm not much of a tea person, but whatever I've tried (I'm not too adventurous, mind you), I've been happy with. I normally gravitate towards their French Press pot of coffee (for $5, you'll get about three cups out of it). The coffee is strong and bold. They only have half and half or almond milk to accompany it, but then again, what do you expect when you order coffee at a tea shop?

If you're hungry, Bantha has numerous snacks from local bakeries and soup from Spoon, which my wife has always raved about.

The staff is friendly, helpful, and likes to strike up conversations with their regulars. The owner, Jack, has built the business up over the past few years from a small tea counter to a neighborhood asset. The shop has a small performance area, two bathrooms, and the walls are decorated with local art.

Bantha is a vibrant small business with a fun cast of characters. Spend an afternoon there, and you'll see a steady stream of regulars and hear some interesting conversations while enjoying some tea or coffee. It's a great place to hang out at when the weather is warm and you're looking to chill out with a friend.

Love that I found this great little tea house. They have a wide selection of teas and herbal drinks that can pick you up or calm you down whatever you need. They even have differnt Kratom teas and CBD oil additions. The iced Green Bali (Kratom) with lemon CBD is my favorite. 

They also have local baked goods, ice cream, soups and salads. 

The interior is small but enough room to be cozy with reclaimed wood on the walls. They also have a frequent buyer program buy 12 get one free.
Super friendly service in here.  We stopped by to get out of the cold while we were waiting for Apteka to open, and I'm so glad we did.  The focus herbal tea was delicious and I loved the atmosphere.

Friendly service. I went here once to meet friends and we tried some of their teas. I went another time to buy some earl grey loose leaf tea. The tea was excellent but expensive (an ounce costs 6 $, sometimes more). They have a selection of small eats that I haven't tried yet.

Bantha has it all. Great, friendly and knowledgeable staff, a progressive menu offering teas that the Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts do not. 

If you don't know what you want or what you might like, they'll help. If you're looking for a new spot to become a regular, I highly suggest it.

The owners really do enjoy what they do and it shows through every aspect of the business. Can't recommend this place enough.

P.S. Try the Kava ! All of the Kava!

I like this a lot.  I commonly go for tea as they have a great selection and are a bit more of a apothecary than tea house 

With that said. Why did I give such a bad review?

I really dislike listening to the owner, don't know name. Has a kid and is going to Iron Maiden concert. Only overheard this.  He talks soooo LOUD and swears constantly.  Every other sentence has sweat words and he is oblivious to customers who don't want to listen to it.  He is very nice!   But as an owner be more aware of your customers and their feelings.  One lady order food and drink to sit in.  She heard him, kept looking at him and decided to take it to go.

Been coming here for sometime. One thing I can say is that they are consistent. Our food came out hot. We ordered a couple of burgers. Burgers were juicy and very flavorful. Music was just a bit to loud along with the TVs. It's a sports bar. What should we expect. They have a smoking section outdoors but that day the weather was perfect so I assumed that that was the reason why they left the doors open but I really did care for inhaling someone else's lung exhaust every time I took a bite of my burger as I didn't order it as a smoked burger. The waitress was nice. The fries there are also the best I have ever eaten anywhere.
Would love to rate them a 3+ or more but the smoke thing kind of turned us off that day. We will come back though it may have been an oversight that day leaving the door open.

My fiancé and I tried it for the first time after some family members mentioned it was good.  We went in on Saturday afternoon and sat at the bar, Shannon was behind the bar and she was AMAZING!  So sweet and welcoming, very helpful and just a delight to be around!  We both ordered the scorpion burger which was really good, we had both anticipated it to be a little spicer but it was still delicious!  I can't recall the IPA they had on draft but it was so good!  We will absolutely be back again!

I went for the first time for my birthday & came back the very same week!  Yum!   The chicken chicharrones are to DIE for!  I highly recommend the moonshine flight if you want to try something different.  Definitely a hidden jewel in our community!
Recently moved to the area.  Food was fresh and tasted great. Case was our server and was very attentive without being annoying. Made great suggestions. Will definitely return.

Ordered through Grubhub. Mac and cheese was delicious! But 2 bites in my fork pulled up a gross long black hair. It was sitting on top baked with the cheese crust. I was so grossed out and disappointed because the food really was delicious but this is something they should be careful with and look at when serving their food.

Worse blue cheese burger I have ever had. Food was all very greasy. My burger was dripping grease. Very slow service and waited 40 minutes to get my meal. Avoid this place like the plague. I am not even sure my burger was real beef. Yikes!

This place was BOMB! My husband and I checked this place out on a Wednesday night. It wasn't crazy busy and we got seated right away! 

Our server was Hayden and he was excellent. We picked his brain about the food selection and he gave us his honest opinion on some of the dishes and we loved that. He was on top of our table! 

We got the jalapeño boats. THESE ARE A MUST to try. They were BOMB. Crunchy and creamy and just so good!! 

I got the chicken parm sandwich and the chicken in it was amazing. My son had honey mustard sauce and I dipped my sandwich in it, mind blown! 

All the food was so good. I would definitely be coming back!!
Outstanding food and very friendly service. Our server, Abby, was on top of things during the Saturday night rush. We were taken care of quickly and courteously. I'll be back for sure.
Had the grilled cheese burger with waffle fries. Food was average and service was average. Will come back.

Great food options!  Robust beer selection with wide variety of local brews.  Started with garlic fries---pretty good!  My wife and I both settled on the chicken sliders for a meal.  These were D-licious!! Chicken, bacon, spicy mayo, and avocado--hard to screw that up.  I had the cole slaw for my side.  It was your average cole slaw...I wished they would have jazzed it up a bit.  

The menu was HUGE.  We will definitely be back to try out some other menu items.  Good food and service!!

Best chinese food in the area. I have to admit I have not actually ate inside but I get carry out regularly. I order and pay online before i leave work. I tell them what time I want it. I run in and pick it up on way home. Very easy and I have never had a bad experience. The orange chicken is so good!

Do not let the 60s decor fool you.  This is an excellent Chinese food restaurant. It specializes in Cantonese, which isn't as trendy Sichuan and Hunan, but the dishes are quality and have generous portions. The Hot and Sour soup and General Tzu's chicken are standout items.

Very Americanized Chinese food. Nothing amazing. The spicy hot and sour and egg drop soups were good. They didn't have that's syrupy texture which sometimes creeps me out. The prices are reasonable. Atmosphere was dated, ala 1980s place.
They did a birthday dinner for us. 12 people. Food was good, hot and tons of it! Good service and great prices. Thanks!
Great classic dishes. Love the service. Great place, highly recommend. We go several times a month.
This place is sooo good. I stop by once a week for the shrimp rice and egg flower soup! Love it! Plus, they have a great lunch special!

yes, teh decor is a massive throw back and the bar is a cave, but we found many dishes to be quite good.  the pork chow mein and pork fried rice are really good, the bbq pork slices (char siu) on the appetizers is very good too.  have not tried many of the mroe eccentric dishes, but we have tried many of the normal staples and found them quite tasty.  this is not PF CH#$%'s, just a neighborhood joint.  once you get used to it, the very very very dated decor kind of grows on you.

Really Kwan's to me is somewhere between a 4 (on a good day) and a 2 (on a not so good day).  The trouble is consistency... you are never quite sure what day it'll be until you have ordered your food.  At times the food is very good and fresh tasting, but at other times (like last night), it tastes a bit "old" and reheated.  This is especially true with their chicken and pork dishes.  Nothing like the distinct flavor of microwave tasting reheated chicken in breading.  I'm not saying that is what they do, but that is how it tastes to me from time to time.  The people are nice and it seems to be a nice family run business, but I can't say it wouldn't be a regular stop for our family if it were any further away.  If they could simply figure out how to keep the food (chicken and pork) tasting fresh and not reheated on a day to day basis, I know we would go more often.

I have lived in the valley for 35 yrs.  I have been ordering from Kwan's for 32 yrs.  I love supporting busniness's in our neighborhood.  They have always been very pleasant when picking up orders or dinning in.  Thru the years this restaurant has always had great food and great service, always served with a smile.  It's so nice to see they are still here in our neighborhood.  I like the authenticy this restaurant has always shown, and what a great staple for our neighborhood to be here over 50 yrs!

Fun fact: American Chinese restaurants have started to open in China. Products and ingredients needed to recreate these adapted dishes are imported, including Philadelphia cream cheese, Skippy peanut butter, cornflakes and English mustard powder. Also, General Tso (Zuo) never had that chicken.

Kwan's is American Chinese cuisine. And it is go-oo-ood. You can now order online, which for me, is tops! 

The restaurant is located on the southwest side of a retail complex. It is easily seen from the street. The entry has a bench and service counter. There is no bell or anything, so you may wait there for a few minutes before being greeted. There is nice decor and a large carved statue that has been there forever. There is some new weird octopus lamp that was interesting. The dining room is quite large, and is comfortable. There is also a northwest separate bar. The bar is dark and divey. I never see many people in there, and I have never been, so I can't say why.
The food is always hot and tasty. Our favorites, and let's face it, the things we order every single time, are:
Shrimp egg foo yong. Large and dense patties with a thick, salty brown gravy. There are 3 patties in an order. Bay shrimp are plentiful in the patties.
House fried rice. Soy marinated rice (brown colored fried rice, not white or yellow), with peas, egg, chicken, beef, pork and bay shrimp. 
Crab Rangoon. Not star-shaped, but little pouches. There are 10 per order. I feel like there isn't any crab, but I still love these little fried gems anyway.
BBQ pork ribs. J loves these. Lots of sweet and salty sauce. He says they're great, o think they're a bit fatty.
Beef skewers. A good serving of marinated beef skirt. Some farrier than others. But I like no fat, and J likes the fat. So we're usually both happy.
The egg foo yong is always served with steamed white rice as well. You also receive ample fortune cookies, soy sauce, hot mustard and duck sauce. 
This is a great place to be bad. Try anything on the menu, and you will likely be pleased. Good service, good menu selections,  good quality.

Love this place! I'm from southeast Florida and miss the diverse food options there so finding Punta Cana made me feel at home. The food is awesome, resonably priced, and the staff is always super friendly and accommodating. The chicharron de pollo was disappointing, however I highly recommend the stewed chicken or pollo ala plancha as both were super yummy! I will definitely be back.

Dude where do I start...!  So when I get there I ask about the menu and it is apparent that I've never been here before I ask what type of restaurant is this come to find out it's a Dominican base restaurant. Instead of the waiter helping me navigate through the menus he walks away and For about three minutes then comes back and asked me if I would like a drink. I put my drink order in he comes back a minute to two minutes later and I'm still asking about a normal way to would assist someone with selecting their mail knowing that they're new to the restaurant he left again so I asked him for his advice when he returns he told me what his advice was and I chose it.
The mail came very quick because there was nobody there I should've took my warning the food was not seasoned the way I was expecting it to be but it was edible and I ate that meal completely because I was hungry I asked for another drink thinking that there were refills on the lemonade oh no you pay for your lemonade each one which might I tell you the glass of lemonade if I would've known I would've asked for less ice.
I was finished eating and my waiter sat down to eat his meal needless to tell you I sat there an extra 20 minutes waiting on him to send my finish eating his meal so I can cash out on my meal,  it was so bad that the other waitress had to come over and assist and take my plate.
It was so bad I had to get up go to the cashier and asked to see if I could cash out my waiter got up rang the ticket gave it to me in a booklet in front of my face at at the register, needless to say I was not very happy with the service there and the mail was very expensive one meal cost me $17.95 and he added his tip into the equation, mind you he short changed himself.
